 We are looking for a person with servant leadership and software product development experience. We believe you have ability to create an environment that foster high performing teams. You are used to working will multiple stakeholders and have the capability to facilitate workshops and perform activity & story mapping exercises.
 



 As a person you are solution and delivery oriented with a strong drive and problem-resolution approach. Manages conflict, drives engagement, builds effective teams and optimizes work processes. You are culture and people driven, with a team before me mind-set.
 



 A true collaborator and networker who can communicate efficiently and effectively with everyone on all levels We are looking for an engaging, courageous person who shows curiosity, innovation and playfulness and constantly works to enable organizational learning

 • Scaled Agile Framework, Scrum and DevOps familiarity and experience in Lean Agile methods
 



 • Organizing and leading Scrum ceremonies.
 



 • Removing impediments that hinder the team’s progress.
 



 • Promoting collaboration and adherence to Scrum principles and values
 



 • They bridge the needs of product management, sales, marketing, operations, and product Excellent knowledge of Scrum techniques, strong communication skills, and experience in software development
 



  





 Soft Skills :
 



 · Ability to manage and coordinate multiple projects concurrently
 



 · Self-starter with the ability to independently resolve issues and deliver results
 



 · Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
 



 · Strong analytical / Problem Solving skills

title: Tester
company_industry: IT Services and IT Consulting and IT System Testing and Evaluation
description:
Role - Tester
 



 Type - Remote
 



 Deadline - 07/03/25
 



 Certification - ISTQB Foundation Level (Mandatory)
 



  





**Requirements:** 



* University degree with minimum 3 years of experience in IT OR non university degree with minimum 6 years of experience in IT.
* Minimum 3 years of information systems testing experience.
* Experience of 3 years as Application Tester or a similar role.
* Knowledge of industry standards on testing methodologies, technologies and tools.
* Professional focus in software testing, primarily web-based software.
* Experience documenting defects and producing test documentation in a clear and constant way (e.g. respecting naming conventions)
* Experience in testing planning, monitoring, control, reporting, collecting and reporting on metrics.
* Experience of creating tests (test cases, scenarios, data, etc.) from requirements and design specifications.
* Experience in setting up and maintaining the test environment.
* Experience working with work item management tools (e.g. Azure DevOps, TFS or Jira).
* Understanding of Unified Modelling Language (UML).
* Experience in creating and maintaining automation scripts with Microsoft Playright or similar framework.
* Experience with Continuous Integration Principles and pipelines.
* Experience with DevOps practices for test automation.
* Understanding of relevant technology/ies (e.g. .Net, TypeScript, JavaScript)
* Experience in web frontend troubleshooting.
* Certification of ISTQB Foundation Level (or equivalent)
* Understanding of relevant technology/ies (e.g. .Net, C#) is considered an asset.
* Excellent command of the English language.

title: Tester
DevOps Engineer
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
 DevOps is a critical part of our platform strategy. As a member of the DevOps team, you will focus on providing technical expertise and support to our engineering teams to enable them to deliver high-quality software solutions efficiently.
   

  

 This includes providing continuous support to teams, overcoming major technical hurdles, improving performance , implementing system monitoring and building highly available software.
   

  

 YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:
   

  

* Approaching Operations as a Software Engineering challenge applying software engineering to solve operational challenges.
* Being the first point of contact for our Operations and Dev teams for any questions and issues regarding our platform.
* Having a positive attitude and the ability to understand the critical urgency of topics and strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Ensuring non-functional requirements for all applications and tools are met and clearly communicated.
* Providing counsel to our internal software engineering team and proactively suggesting improvements on how to operate our microservice-based solution.


 OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 ESSENTIAL SKILLS:
   

  

* Minimum 5 years of software engineering or devops experience.
* Practical experience in using common cloud APIs
* Strong knowledge of Linux and shell scripting, as well as higher level protocols and patterns like HTTP/3, REST, JSON and gRPC
* Expertise in systems integration and distributed large scale microservice deployments
* Experience in operating and monitoring container workloads and similar technologies
* Strong code reading and understanding skills with at least one high level programming language


 NICE TO HAVES:
   

  

* Experience from the iGaming industry is meriting


**Who We Are**
 At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide.
   

  

**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.


 JOIN US!
   

  

 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Senior Infrastructure Cloud Architect, Professional Services
description:
**Description**
 As a Senior Cloud Infrastructure Architect, you will contribute with presales and led complex projects as a Delivery Technical Leader, often involving multiple Amazon and customer teams. You will lead and enable them by applying Amazon Day 1 culture and developing technical expertise to deliver solutions tailored to their business needs.
   

  

 You will work with customers and partners supporting them through planning, prioritization and delivery of complex transformation initiatives, while collaborating with relevant Sales and Service Teams. You will help create and apply frameworks, methods, best practices and artifacts that deliver prescriptive guidance to customers, and publish and present them in large forums and across various media platforms. You will provide guidance regarding customers’ technical architecture and investments, maximizing alignment with the AWS platform, and ease of adoption as new services and products become available. You will work towards customer business outcomes, ensuring there is a strong connection between delivery activities and business objectives.
   

  

 Do you have experience leading and delivering large IT solutions in agile environment - plan, organize, and manage all phases of a project lifecycle to ensure successful delivery on a scale?
   

  

 Come build the future with us.
   

  

**About The Team**
 Diverse Experiences
   

  

 Amazon values diverse experiences. Even if you do not meet all of the preferred qualifications and skills listed in the job description, we encourage candidates to apply. If your career is just starting, hasn’t followed a traditional path, or includes alternative experiences, don’t let it stop you from applying.
   

  

 Why AWS
   

  

 Amazon Web Services (AWS) is the world’s most comprehensive and broadly adopted cloud platform. We pioneered cloud computing and never stopped innovating — that’s why customers from the most successful startups to Global 500 companies trust our robust suite of products and services to power their businesses.
   

  

 Work/Life Balance
   

  

 We value work-life harmony. Achieving success at work should never come at the expense of sacrifices at home, which is why we strive for flexibility as part of our working culture. When we feel supported in the workplace and at home, there’s nothing we can’t achieve in the cloud.
   

  

 Inclusive Team Culture
   

  

 Here at AWS, it’s in our nature to learn and be curious. Our employee-led affinity groups foster a culture of inclusion that empower us to be proud of our differences. Ongoing events and learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences, inspire us to never stop embracing our uniqueness.
   

  

 Mentorship and Career Growth
   

  

 We’re continuously raising our performance bar as we strive to become Earth’s Best Employer. That’s why you’ll find endless knowledge-sharing, mentorship and other career-advancing resources here to help you develop into a better-rounded professional.
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
* Multiple years of IT implementation experience in customer-facing roles
* Track record as technical leader driving engagements and guiding customer investment decisions
* Experience driving discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation
* Experience driving presales with senior customer stakeholders in collaboration with internal teams
* Hands-on programming/scripting experience to drive the design, development and deployment of business software infrastructure at scale


**Preferred Qualifications**
* BS level technical degree with Computer Science or Math background
* Proven track record of implementing AWS services in large scale cloud migrations and highly available and fault-tolerant enterprise software deployments
* Experience with IT compliance and risk management requirements (e.g., security, privacy, SOX, ISO, HIPAA etc.)
* AWS Certifications, e.g., AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional


 Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy\_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.
   

  

  

**Company** 
 - AWS EMEA SARL (Sweden Branch)

title: Full Stack Developer | SEB, Solna
description:
Join SEB as a Senior Full Stack .NET Developer! Contribute your .NET and front-end skills to our API Products team. Mentor API developers and drive innovation and API excellency. Apply now and be part of a dynamic team!
   

  

 At SEB, technology fuels our mission to deliver world-class financial services across 20 global sites. Join a team of over 2800 innovators shaping the future of finance by blending cutting-edge technology with the dynamic world of global markets. Here, your work will influence financial flows, enabling us to deliver exceptional client experiences through robust systems, advanced AI, and a forward-thinking tech stack.
   

  

**About The Role**
 We are excited to welcome a skilled Senior Full Stack .NET Developer to our API Products team. Our team of .NET developers focuses on API best practices, ensuring secure and consistent API exposure. You will contribute your .NET expertise and front-end knowledge to the team. Passionate about building reliable and scalable applications and help others to do the same? Experience as a Tech Lead or Scrum Master is a plus. Reach out!
   

  

 Key Responsibilities:
   

  

* Design, develop, and maintain .NET APIs and applications.
* Work with cross-functional teams to define and release new features and APIs.
* Mentor junior developers to support their growth.
* Ensure API alignment, performance, quality, and responsiveness.
* Share knowledge and contribute to the SEB API development community.
* Participate in code reviews for continuous improvement.
* Rotate as Scrum Master and support internal team roles.
* Provide tools and support to internal API developers.
* Build products using internal APIs.


 To thrive in this role, we believe you have
   

  

 Stong communication skills and teamwork abilities. As a person we think you have attention to detail and great problem-solving skills. You also have a strong desire to improve, grow and drive the team and its contributions within SEB. We do also believe that you have experience within:
   

  

* 5+ years of experience in full stack development with .NET technologies.
* Strong skills in C#, Blazor, spec-first APIs, and application architecture.
* Proficiency in .NET front-end development, with a basic understanding of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks (e.g., Angular, React).
* Experience with SQL, NoSQL, database design, DevOps, and cloud hosting.


 It’s also considered meritorious if you have:
   

  

* Experience as a Tech Lead and/or Scrum Master.


 What we offer
   

  

 At SEB, we provide an empowering and inclusive environment where your career journey is uniquely yours. Here’s what you can look forward to:
   

  

* Opportunities to contribute to SEB’s top-priority initiatives.
* A collaborative, friendly, and welcoming culture.
* Diverse, international teams in a global working environment.
* Competitive compensation with exclusive SEB staff banking benefits.
* A modern hybrid work model and state-of-the-art office spaces.


 Ready to take the next step on your career journey?
   

  

 Welcome to our inclusive culture, where our shared values inspire and uplift our team. We celebrate diversity and strive to ensure every employee feels seen, heard, and valued.
   

  

 Since we select candidates continuously, feel free to send in your application today, but no later than 16th of March 2025. If you have questions about the position, please contact Mats Utterström, Hiring Manager, at mats.utterstrom@seb.se
   

  

 Learn more about working at SEB here: www.sebgroup.com/techcareers
   

  

 It is our fundamental belief that inclusion and diversity is crucial for our future success. We strive to have an inclusive, value-driven culture where employees feel valued, respected and involved irrespective of who they are, what they believe or where they come from.

title: Senior Project Manager, Digital Technologies
description:
**We are looking for a Senior Project Manager within** **Digital Technologies****focusing on foreign direct** **investments** **in the Swedish ICT and Tech sector.**

Business Sweden has a unique mandate, assigned by the Swedish government and the private sector. We contribute to the welfare of society by accelerating the growth of Swedish companies abroad and helping international companies invest and expand in Sweden. We work with leading companies of the world, and we thrive on knowing that we help our customers close the best deals.


In this role, you will be part of a team in attracting and facilitating leading international companies to invest, innovate and expand in Sweden and enter partnerships with Swedish companies, as well as support Swedish Digital Technology companies in their internationalization.


You will be part of a team for the Digital Technology industry’s global investment promotion work and together with the team drive trade promotion including:


* Developing, executing and following up on the Digital Technology industry investment promotion business plan and follow-up on KPIs, budget and results.
* Full chain responsibility of the investment process; to the identification of investment opportunities in Sweden, crafting value propositions, strategic outreach efforts, and up to the project deliver to the client y to land investments into Sweden.
* Leading and supporting our colleagues in delivering targeted investment attraction projects in Business Sweden’s focus markets.
* Coordinating the cooperation and project deliveries with Swedish regional partners and other stakeholders in the ecosystem.
* Drive initiatives and activities to help leading Digital Technologies companies grow globally, together with the Business Sweden offices around the world.
* Work closely with the Swedish Digital Technology ecosystem and Team Sweden to contribute to increased export for Swedish companies and foreign investments.

The work also requires collaboration and coordination with relevant stakeholders and strategic partners in the Digital Technologies ecosystem throughout the process on international, national and regional levels, simultaneously.


You will report to the Head of Life Science, Digital Technologies & Consumer Goods. The position can be based in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Malmö depending on the dialogue with the candidate. You will work closely together with your colleagues across Sweden and globally. The position will require travelling when needed in Sweden and abroad.


  
SKILLS & REQUIREMENTS


**Core competencies and collaborative skills**

* Demonstrate commitment, honesty, and accountability in tasks.
* Experience in project management, providing support and taking ownership to ensure high quality delivery on time.
* Collaborate effectively to achieve good results with a positive can-do attitude.
* Contribute to team spirit and maintaining a transparent communication throughout/with all channels/stakeholders/partners.
* A problem solver who easily adapts to new ways of working and finds it rewarding exploring new opportunities.
* Voice your own ideas and share opinions. Show appreciation for different perspectives from the Tech/ICT sector, the governmental assignments and Team Sweden’s joint efforts.

**Formal requirements**

* Higher academic degree, probably a MSc, MBA or equivalent.
* Solid tech background (+10 years) from the ICT and/or emerging tech industry with focus on critical infrastructure (e.g. from networks, computing, cloud platforms, IoT, AI, or other emerging tech areas).
* Strong technical understanding and knowledge of digital transformation and innovation.
* Considerable know-how from business development, corporate strategy and/or marketing.
* A broad and relevant network within the ICT & tech ecosystem in Sweden.
* Understanding of industry-academic collaborations is meriting.
* Working knowledge of the Swedish promotional agencies and Team Sweden is an asset.
* A high level of proficiency in both written and spoken Swedish and English is a requirement.

**Application**  

Please submit your resume as soon as possible as we will be screening applications on a rolling basis. Your application will be handled confidentially.


GREAT PLACE TO WORK


Global exchanges and career opportunities


Exclusive focus on our client’s growth agenda


Extensive responsibility


Diversified teams with world class colleagues


Training academy for continuous development


Entrepreneurial environment


ABOUT THE COMPANY


**Diversity powering global growth**



At Business Sweden we value and encourage applications from candidates with diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We strive for a workplace where all colleagues can explore their full potential and contribute with their unique experiences. By embracing a wide range perspective, we can better drive sustainable growth and customer-centric excellence.


**About Business Sweden**



Business Sweden helps Swedish companies grow global sales and international companies invest and expand in Sweden. With a unique mandate from the Swedish government and the business sector, we offer strategic advice and practical support in more than 40 markets worldwide.


Our mission is to help lay the foundation for sustainable, inclusive, and digital growth – in Sweden and around the world. We do this by providing startups, small- and medium sized companies and multinationals with tailored services, coupled with access to key stakeholders in the public and private spheres.


We help our clients build relationships, accelerate time-to-market, and comply with local standards and regulations. Visit business-sweden.com for more information.

  

  

OUR VALUESOur high performance culture rests on that all our employees live our core values. We will never have guidelines for every situation we will meet, but if all of us are guided by a strong sense of our values, we will always navigate in the right direction.
RESPONSIBILITYThis is the foundation of our culture. Taking responsibility is a way to show commitment to our work. We take ownership of the relationships with our clients and stay true to our word.
COLLABORATIONAlone we can do so little; together we can do so much. Collaboration knows no geographical borders. At Business Sweden, we act as one global team to create the best possible value for our clients.
IMPACTBy monitoring the world around us and identifying possibilities , we make a difference by helping companies to seize new, sustainable business opportunities. We create impact both for our clients and for Sweden.

title: QA Engineer - Markets
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**


Are you an experienced software engineer looking for a meaningful role in a dynamic environment? Join our Markets Platform Team at LeoVegas Group, where you will play a crucial role in enhancing our global customer onboarding process and developing responsible gaming features. Your work will ensure a seamless, secure, and enjoyable experience for our customers across all our brands.

  

In this position, you will focus on refining the onboarding journey and promoting responsible gaming. Our mission is to create a safe gaming environment where players can set healthy limits on their gambling habits. We leverage data-driven insights and a robust CI/CD process, following the Kanban methodology to deliver high-quality solutions. You will work alongside expert back-end developers specialising in Java and Kotlin, as well as dedicated Quality Assurance Engineers.

  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**

* Developing a multi-brand gaming platform called Rhino, built on 230+ microservices.
* Driving continuous improvement in the player onboarding process and responsible gaming solutions through innovative solutions.
* Testing (unit, regression, smoke) and updating documentation.
* Participating in architectural discussions and suggesting ideas for technical improvements.
* Collaborate with Product Managers and other stakeholders to deliver innovative solutions that enhance customer onboarding and promote responsible gaming.
* Working closely with Backend Engineers, QA Engineers and TA Engineers.

 **OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**


ESSENTIAL SKILLS

* Min. 4 years of experience in using Java + Spring Boot framework
* You have experience with MySQL
* You are familiar with microservice architectures
* You are ISTQB certified


NICE TO HAVES

* Experience with Kotlin, Git, Kafka, Jenkins, Akka, Hazelcast, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, with Consul.
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery.
* Strong understanding of API testing methodologies and hands-on experience with tools like Postman.
* Knowledge of Automated Testing.

 **WHO WE ARE**


At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.  



**BENEFITS**

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation day
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

 **JOIN US!**


In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*

title: Data Engineering Team Lead
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**


We are looking for a Data Engineering Team Lead to oversee and drive the development of our data engineering team. You will play a key role in managing direct reports, ensuring that team deliverables align with the company’s overall strategy, and having a voice in daily deployments. This is a leadership role where you will focus on team management, mentorship, and technical oversight.


Additionally, you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of data solutions across the organization. Your ability to align engineering initiatives with business objectives will be crucial in shaping the future of our data-driven decision-making processes.

 **YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:*** Lead and manage the Data Engineering team, ensuring smooth operations and alignment with business goals.
* Supervise daily deployments and actively contribute to decision-making regarding deployed solutions.
* Conduct code reviews, ensuring best practices and high-quality standards in BigQuery, SQL, Python, and GCP solutions.
* Define, implement, and continuously improve data architecture, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency.
* Develop comprehensive data models that support business objectives and maintain high data quality. Establish and enforce governance best practices to ensure compliance, security, and optimal data management across the organization.
* Conduct regular 1-2-1 reviews, salary reviews, and provide mentorship to team members.
* Drive and motivate the team, ensuring high performance and continuous development.
* Lead daily stand-ups and ensure effective communication within the team.
* Collaborate with stakeholders to align technical decisions with business strategy.

 **OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:*** Strong leadership skills with experience managing direct reports.
* Proven experience in Data Engineering or Software Engineering.
* Expertise in BigQuery, SQL, Python, and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Strong understanding of data modeling, data architecture and best practices.
* Experience in conducting code reviews and ensuring high-quality standards.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to mentor and motivate a team.
* Ability to drive strategy while also being involved in daily technical discussions.

 **WHO WE ARE**  

At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices worldwide.  

  

**BENEFITS**  

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation *(**T&C apply)*
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

 **JOIN US!**


In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

title: SAP HCM Senior Consultant
description:
**Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.**

**Gå med i vårt vinnande team!**  



**Capgemini Sverige expanderar sitt Human Capital Management (HCM) team inom vår PBS-enhet, och vi söker en Senior SAP HCM-konsult för att stödja våra nyckelkunder inom offentlig sektor. Detta är en fantastisk möjlighet att arbeta med ett vinnande team med över 100 lokala konsulter på plats, utnyttja banbrytande AI-driven teknik och få tillgång till tiotusentals professionella utvecklingskurser.**  



**OM ROLLEN**

**Som Senior SAP HCM-konsult kommer du att spela en avgörande roll i att leverera högkvalitativa HR- och lönelösningar inom SAP S/4HANA-miljöer. Du kommer att arbeta nära intressenter för att analysera, designa, konfigurera, testa och underhålla HR-lösningar, och säkerställa effektivitet och efterlevnad av offentliga sektorns standarder.**

**Dina ansvarsområden kommer att inkludera:**

* **Applikationskonsultation & support:** **Ge expertstöd inom SAP HCM, särskilt inom lön och tidshantering.**
* **Systemutveckling & underhåll:** **Hantera kravinsamling, lösningsdesign, konfiguration, testning och dokumentation.**
* **Strategisk vägledning:** **Agera som en betrodd rådgivare för HR-systemstyrning och bästa praxis.**
* **Agil samarbete:** **Arbeta inom en agil ram (SAFe, Scrum eller SAP Activate).**
* **Ledarskap & utbildning:** **Leda mindre team och projekt samtidigt som du mentor klientteam.**
* **Tvärfunktionell samordning:** **Samarbeta med andra avdelningar och externa leverantörer.**

**DIN PROFIL**

**Vi söker erfarna SAP HCM-specialister med expertis inom ett eller flera av följande områden:**

* **SAP HCM Lön (offentlig sektor) & tidshantering**
* **Arbetskraftsplanering & HR-analys**
* **SAP S/4HANA HR & Fiori Launchpad**
* **SAP Activate, SAFe, Scrum eller ITIL-ramverk**
* **Ledarskap & teamhantering**

**DU HAR:**

* **10+ års erfarenhet av SAP HCM-konsultation (lön, tid, PA/talang, OM eller resehantering)**
* **5+ års erfarenhet av ledarskapsroller (teamledare, gruppledare eller projektledning)**
* **2+ års praktisk erfarenhet av SAP HCM på SAP S/4HANA**
* **Flytande svenska (skriftligt och muntligt)**

**MERITERANDE:**

* **Certifieringar i agila metoder (SAFe, Scrum, SAP Activate)**
* **Erfarenhet av storskaliga SAP-implementeringar (5000+ användare)**

**CAPGEMINI**

**På Capgemini kommer du att vara en del av ett blomstrande konsultnätverk som erbjuder:** 

* **Ett vinnande team: Över 100+ lokala konsulter på plats i Sverige.**
* **Spännande projekt: Arbeta med toppmodern AI-driven HR-teknik.**
* **Kontinuerligt lärande: Tillgång till 10 000+ utbildningskurser för karriärutveckling.**
* **Innovativ kultur: Var en del av HR-transformationen inom offentlig sektor.**
* **Balans mellan arbete och privatliv: Flexibla arbetsarrangemang och stödjande ledarskap.**

**Är du redo att ta nästa steg i din SAP HCM-karriär? Ansök nu och bli en del av ett team som driver verklig förändring inom HR-teknik!**

  

**Plats:** **Stockholm/Enköping, Sverige.** ***Du kommer v*** ***ara på plats i Enköping stora delar av din arbetstid.***

**#LI-LB2**

**Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. It is a responsible and diverse group of 340,000 team members in more than 50 countries. With its strong over 55-year heritage, Capgemini is trusted by its clients to unlock the value of technology to address the entire breadth of their business needs. It delivers end-to-end services and solutions leveraging strengths from strategy and design to engineering, all fuelled by its market leading capabilities in AI, cloud and data, combined with its deep industry expertise and partner ecosystem. The Group reported 2023 global revenues of €22.5 billion.**
company_description: Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology.

title: IGA System Owner
description:
**IGA System Owner**

  

*Is automation something you find engaging, and do you aim to provide remarkable service? Do you thrive in a Nordic team, managing a large system landscape, and contributing to a high-priority project with the right resources at your disposal? If that sounds appealing, this role could be a great match!*

  

GlobalConnect is undergoing a significant IT transformation, transitioning from legacy systems to innovative technologies, and moving from manual processes to smart automation. As part of this journey, we have chosen the SailPoint platform to automate access authorizations and identity management, aiming for a more efficient and security-focused approach to Identity Governance and Administration (IGA).

  

In this role, you will serve as the system owner for SailPoint, contributing significantly to the implementation project, establishing rules for roles, and automating access management. This large-scale project will initially encompass around 115 systems, expanding later to cover the entire system landscape. We are making substantial investments in this project, ensuring all necessary resources are allocated, and you will directly witness the impact of your contributions on the organization.

  

You will be a part of a team consisting of 6 other members focusing on IAM and collaboration. The team purpose is to “Empowering GlobalConnect to securely manage identities, access and collaboration across the digital workplace, driving operational efficiency and safeguarding assets in a rapidly evolving landscape.”

  

If you are motivated by improving efficiency, enhancing collaboration, prioritizing security, and thrive in organizing and making decisions with a big-picture view, this role will suit you well. We also place great emphasis on user experience and the value your service brings to the organization.

  

**To perform well in this role, you should have:**


* Experience with Access Management, Entra ID, Directory Services (e.g., LDAP), and Identity Provisioning.
* Knowledge of API integrations, scripting languages, and identity automation.
* Familiarity with cloud-based directory services, such as Azure AD.
* Experience with JSON, Microsoft PowerShell.
* Experience with RBAC (Role-Based Access Control) for authenticated applications and resources.
  


Prior experience with IAM (Identity and Access Management), PAM (Privileged Access Management), or IGA (Identity Governance and Administration) is beneficial for this role.


Since GlobalConnect is integral to the digital infrastructure throughout the Nordics, the applicant selected will need to complete background security clearance.

  

We look forward to receiving your application!

  

GlobalConnect is owned by EQT and is the fastest growing provider of connectivity solutions and digital infrastructure across Northern Europe. We are the result of recent mergers between Broadnet, GlobalConnect and IP-Only - now operating as one company in Norway, Denmark, Sweden, Germany and Finland. Our 1 600 employees ensure that we are the main challenger on each market by delivering secure and future proof solutions to some of the world’s largest companies as well as to private households. And everything in between.


We have helped develop and digitize societies across the Nordics for more than two decades. Our purpose is what drives us to continue - turning visions into reality by empowering society with connectivity.


Location:
Stockholm, SE, 111 34
Location:
Stockholm, SE, 111 34
With GlobalConnect being present in both Norway, Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Germany we have employees from many nationalities. We connect people and organizations across society. It starts with the foundation of our digital infrastructure and ends with all the things we enable. We strive to simplify the complicated and live by our customer promise and internal value-led behaviors - being E A S Y to work with (Expertise, Available, Speed, You).

title: CLOUD PLATFORM SECURITY ENGINEER
description:
City: Solna
Job Function: IT
**About the Team:**
-------------------

The Cloud Platform Team at SAS empowers product teams to build cloud-native solutions while enhancing the developer experience and providing a robust platform for innovation. We support teams organized in value streams across multiple products. Cloud Platform Team is divided into sub-teams that focus on different areas such as Cloud, Kubernetes and Developer experience.  

  

The Cloud Platform Team in SAS provides various capabilities to enable our product teams to build cloud-native solutions with greater developer experience and provide them with cloud platform to innovate. We support our product teams who are organized in value streams with several products. The Cloud Platform Team is segregated into several sub-teams which focus on different areas.


**Job Description:**
--------------------

As a Security Engineer in the Cloud Platform Team, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and overseeing security strategies, policies, and procedures to protect against potential risks and vulnerabilities. You will work closely with product teams and fellow security experts to promote security best practices and ensure our standards are met.


In this role, you will lead the integration of security practices into the cloud infrastructure and throughout the software development lifecycle, aiming to minimize friction while strengthening the organization’s overall security posture.


**Challenges you will work on:**
--------------------------------

* Drive adoption of security practices like DDoS protection, CSPM, and Cloud Native Application Protection to secure cloud environments.
* Participate in disaster recovery planning and threat modeling to prepare for security incidents.
* Collaborate with Cloud Platform sub-teams to integrate security into cloud infrastructure services at every stage.
* Work with cross-functional teams to implement security best practices and adopt secure development practices, emphasizing “shifting security left.”
* Stay updated on cyber threats, trends, and technologies, offering recommendations to enhance security.
* Provide security guidance and training to Cloud Platform teams and stakeholders.
* Support compliance with regulatory requirements, audits, and information security policies.
* Foster a culture of security awareness across the organization.
**To be successful, we believe you have:**
------------------------------------------

* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a similar field.
* 3+ years in IT security roles.
* Strong understanding of cybersecurity practices for protecting cloud infrastructure and applications.
* Hands-on experience with cloud security and application security best practices.
* Knowledge of cloud security frameworks (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and practices.
* Knowledge of Kubernetes and Containerization security best practices, tools and standards.
* Familiar with GDPR, NIS2, and ISO 27001/2 regulatory standards.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Proactive problem solver with a data-driven mindset.
* Keen to expand knowledge and consistently enhance security practices.
* Team player with a positive attitude, passionate about cybersecurity.
**Why SAS?**
------------



At SAS, we offer extensive opportunities for professional development in an international, fast-paced working environment. We are dedicated to the continuous growth of our employees. Working with us comes with a variety of benefits, including:  



* Travel Perks: Enjoy discounted travel opportunities around the world with SAS.
* Health & Wellness: Access to health and wellness benefits, including a newly renovated gym with complimentary classes such as CrossFit and yoga.
* Discounts: Receive discounts from a wide range of brands, as well as on transportation to and from airports, airport shops, hotels, and car rentals.
* Work Environment: Our office location in Frösundavik offers a vibrant workspace with a restaurant, café, and easy access to outdoor activities in Hagaparken and Brunnsviken. Engage in running, tennis, outdoor gym sessions, kayaking, and stand-up paddling with equipment available free of charge.
* Convenient Commute: Benefit from a non-stop bus service connecting our office to Solna station, and commuter trains, alongside a network of cycle paths.
**Other of Importance**
-----------------------


* Deadline for application: 28/03/2025. Please send us your CV as soon as possible, as interviews are conducted continuously and the position may be filled before the application deadline. Note that we are not able to handle any applications that are sent by email, due to GDPR.
* Desired startdate: As soon as possible.
* Position: Fulltime (100%) starting with a 6-month probation period.
* This position is based in Frösundavik, Solna (Stockholm), and you will be expected to work onsite. Remote work may also be an option, depending on the agreement made with your manager.
* To be eligible for this position you need a EU-work permit.


SAS, Scandinavia's leading airline since 1946, operates from its principal hub at Copenhagen Airport (CPH), complemented by hubs in Oslo (OSL) and Stockholm (ARN). Our mission is to connect Scandinavia with the world and the world with Scandinavia. Each year, SAS serves more than 25 million passengers and transports 55 tons of cargo to 135 destinations across Europe, the USA, and Asia. With a passionate workforce of over 10,000 colleagues, we collaborate with partners and customers to drive transformative changes in aviation. We are committed to achieving net-zero emissions by 2050, embodying the visionary spirit of our founders: “To move from the old to what is about to come, is the only tradition worth keeping”. Innovation and societal progress are at the heart of everything we do. For

title: Cybersecurity Analyst
description:
Are you a creative and technically skilled cybersecurity professional with a passion for digital forensics, threat hunting, and incident response? Do you thrive in fast-paced environments where continuous learning and adaptability are key? Join our Global Security Operations Center (SOC/CERT) team and help us protect Telia against evolving cyber threats.


We are at the frontline of cybersecurity operations, working across Nordics and Baltics, and are now looking for a new colleague to join our team in Stockholm. Our mission is to prevent, detect, and respond to cybersecurity incidents while continuously improving Telia’s resilience against cyber threats.


**As a Cybersecurity Analyst…**

You will take the lead in handling cybersecurity incidents, conducting threat hunts, and performing digital forensic investigations. Your role will involve coordinating response actions, working closely with security analysts and stakeholders to mitigate risks and improve overall security posture. You will analyze threat intelligence, provide input to the security engineering team for improving detection capabilities, and contribute to the teams continuous development of security tools and processes.


You will collaborate with a broad range of internal stakeholders, ensuring security processes and routines are effective and continuously improved. Your ability to work under pressure, solve complex security challenges, and proactively identify threats will be key to success in this role. Additionally, you will be part of an on-call duty rotation, responding to critical security incidents as needed.


**Who We’re Looking For...**

We are looking for a skilled cybersecurity professional with a strong technical background in incident response, digital forensics, and threat intelligence. You should have deep knowledge of both Windows and Linux operating systems, along with a solid understanding of network protocols, including TCP/IP, HTTP(S), DNS, and routing. Hands-on experience with security tools such as SIEM, NDR, EDR, and IDS/IPS is essential, as well as experience conducting forensic analysis of endpoint and network artifacts. Familiarity with scripting and programming to automate security processes is highly valuable, and an understanding of public cloud security is an advantage.


In addition to your technical expertise, you should have strong problem-solving skills, a solution-oriented mindset, and the ability to work well under pressure. You are comfortable leading and coordinating incident response activities while engaging with different stakeholders across the organization. Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, are required for this role, as you will be collaborating across teams and presenting security findings to various audiences.


**We are more than a workplace**

Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn an annual bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.


**Ready to make better happen?**

We are looking forward to your application by 2025-03-14. If you are selected for the next stage in the process, you'll be contacted by our Hiring Manager/Talent Acquisition Partner. Required controls will be performed.


If you want to know more about this position, please contact Head of CERT & DDoS Simon Eklund, by mobile +46735185216 or by email simon.eklund@teliacompany.com.


**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Nattreceptionist Scandic Malmö City
description:
Scandic Malmö City ligger som namnet antyder mycket centralt- vid kanalen med närhet till Gustav Adolfs Torg såväl som Malmös shoppingstråk. Hotellets restaurang är en naturlig mötesplats för våra inresta gäster. Med gäster från världens alla hörn skapar vi dagligen goda relationer med våra gäster. Vår gästnöjdhet är vår prioritet och vi har en mycket stark servicekultur hos oss-en servicekultur som möjliggörs av att vi också har nöjda medarbetare som är stolta över sin arbetsplats och ser möjligheterna att fortsätta utvecklas.


**Nu söker vi en Receptionist till Scandic Malmö City.**



Oavsett varför gästen kommer till oss är det få saker som är så uppskattade som ett vänligt ansikte som hälsar välkommen. Du agerar värd tillsammans med övriga teamet på hotellet och skapar en gästupplevelse i världsklass.



Hos oss får du ta ett stort eget ansvar för att ta de beslut som krävs för att göra gästen nöjd och teamen utvecklar och förbättrar arbetssätt och service i takt med att omvärlden förändras. Vi är nämligen övertygade om att det är när du får utvecklas och bidra med all din kompetens och erfarenhet som vi överträffar gästens förväntningar. På köpet får vi kul på jobbet!



Så ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss – och bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic!


**Vad är innebär rollen?**



Du som arbetar i receptionen är ansvarig för att våra gäster får service i världsklass. Du är spindeln i nätet som ser till att gästen alltid är i fokus. Du är den som går igenom ankomstlistan och lägger tid på detaljerna. Ser till att gästens önskemål uppfylls. Du har alltid ett leende på läpparna och en kreativ lösning i bakfickan. Du löser det mesta och är en stjärna på att vända en missnöjd gäst till en nöjd gäst. Din arbetsplats är vår lobby. För det är där du möter flest gäster. I ansvarsområdet ingår även administrativt arbete, säkerhetsarbete och arbete med försäljning.


Arbetet i receptionen innebär att checka in och ut hotellets gäster, hälsa välkommen och ge gästen den information den behöver om sin vistelse. Du hanterar bokningar i systemet Opera Cloud och hanterar administrativa uppgifter runt gäster och säkerhet. Allt arbete sker med gästnöjdhet och försäljning i fokus.


Hotellet har öppet dygnet runt och det är därför viktigt att du trivs med att arbeta i skift (förmiddagar, eftermiddagar och helger).


**Vem är du?**



För att passa i rollen tror vi att du har en väl utvecklad social förmåga och är kapabel att hantera att det händer många olika saker samtidigt. Det är mycket viktigt att du kan förmedla ett gott värdskap till hotellets gäster.



Du har också vana och kunskap i att arbeta med dator som arbetsredskap.


Eftersom arbetet till stor del består av att kommunicera med gäster är goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska en förutsättning. Talar du ytterligare ett språk är det meriterande.


Allra viktigast är dock dina personliga egenskaper och din inställning. För att passa i rollen behöver du vara en lyhörd och prestigelös lagspelare som tar ett stort ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och helhetsresultatet.


**Information om tjänsten**



Tjänsten är en tillvidareanställning med en inledande provanställning på 6 månader.



Vi tar enbart emot ansökningar via vår hemsida. Alla ansökningar kommer att behandlas löpande och tjänsten kan tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag, varför vi ber dig att ansöka så snart som möjligt. I denna rekrytering använder vi oss av ett enklare test om service vid urvalet.



Vi ser fram emot att välkomna dig till oss på Scandic!



Ps. på vår hemsida kan du läsa mer om vår kultur, vad tjänsten innebär och om våra förmåner!


  
**Vi har riktigt bra förmåner**
-------------------------------


Rabatt när du äter, dricker och övernattar hos oss


Family & Friends rabatt för din familj och vänner


Rabatt hos våra partnerföretag


Pension & försäkringar enligt kollektivavtal


Friskvårdsbidrag


Utbildning och utveckling via interna plattformar


  
Vi når längre när olikheter bejakas. Hos oss får du utrymme att vara dig själv och utvecklas i den riktning du vill, med trygga villkor och schyssta avtal som grund. Ta med dig dina erfarenheter, ditt engagemang och ditt sätt att tänka till oss - bidra till en kultur där vi bryr oss på riktigt: om varandra, våra gäster och vår planet. Välkommen till Scandic.



Delar du våra värderingar?


**BE A PRO** **BE YOU** **BE CARING** **BE BOLD**

  

  

...uppmuntrar alla att göra skillnad för miljön och att det var en av våra kollegor inom housekeeping som kom på idén om ”häng-upp-handduken”.
...i Sverige blivit rankad som besöksnäringens mest attraktiva arbetsgivare två år i rad, i Visitas årliga undersökning.
... bara serverar kaffe som är ekologiskt och Fairtrade eller UTZ-certifierat.
...tack vare vårt stora miljöengagemang, blivit rankad som branschens mest hållbara arbetsgivare elva år i rad, av Sustainable Brand Index.
...under 2014 inledde ett samarbete med organisationen Real Stars, centrerat kring ”Fair Sex”, dvs. arbete mot människo- och sexhandel.

title: Senior Cyber Security Leader
description:
**About us**



Working in the KPMG Cyber Security team, you will be part of a global organization working within various industries and areas together with competent and inspiring colleagues. As a member of the Cyber Security team, you will support our clients in their transformation journeys by identifying and remediating their cyber related challenges. We work shoulder-to-shoulder with executive management, and we always seek digital, innovative, and sustainable solutions to our clients’ challenges.



You will be part of our Cyber Security team which consists of a tight knit group of specialists collaborating and sharing experiences daily. At KPMG, you will have a senior role in our local team but also be a part of the global team of experts who provides advisory services within Cyber security, Strategy and Governance, ISMS design and implementation, IAM, Forensic investigations, Operational Resilience, IT-due diligence and more.



We will support your journey in a fast-paced environment filled with brilliant colleagues. KPMG is consistently recognized as a leader within the cyber security field by external firms, this is something we are very proud of and keen to maintain. The Cyber team of approximately 50 colleagues is part of KPMGs Advisory practice, a social and familiar group of about 130 colleagues with broad competence and expertise within advisory services across multiple sectors.


  
**Skills & Requirements**
-------------------------


**Your role**


* Develop strong **business relationships** and demonstrate operational leadership to deliver client-centric solutions with high quality.
* Continuously contribute to developing the team’s awareness regarding cyber insights, market trends, innovative products and services.
* Be a mentor and coach for the junior team members to support their development journey through constructive feedback and training.
* Effectively manage the commercial and contractual aspects of an engagement to achieve expected levels of client satisfaction and quality.
* Identify new opportunities and support in the continuous development of our service portfolio.


**Skills & Requirements**


**We are looking for** a passionate, forward-thinking and business minded security professional with at least 8 years of experience within Cyber Security. You should be based in Stockholm or Gothenburg. Key competence areas could include but not be limited to areas below


* Cyber Security Strategy, Risk and Governance
* Information Security Management System design and implementation
* Identity and Access Management as well as Privileged Access Management
* Cloud Security
* Data Privacy
* Operational Resilience
* IT-due diligence


We will highly appreciate if you:


* Are a team player with a genuine interest in helping colleagues and customers alike to grow and develop.
* Have a proven track records of sales and leading pursuit teams.
* Have a proven track record of being a successful leader.
* Have previous consulting experience.
* Are a high performer with strong drive and high ambition.
* Are fluent in Swedish & English.
* Hold relevant certifications such as CISM, CISSP, CISA, CRISC, CEH, OSCP, CCSP, ISO 27001 etc.
* Are used to working in an international context with cross border engagements.


**Want to make a difference with us?**



Apply by submitting your CV as soon as possible. Don’t wait with your application as we review applications and are hiring on a rolling basis. If you have any questions about the position, please don’t hesitate to contact Head of Cyber Security Visar Lapashtica, visar.lapashtica@kpmg.se For any questions related to the recruitment process please contact Talent Manager Lasma Indrijaite, lindrijaite@kpmg.com


**We look forward to your application and** for new colleagues to join our team!


**About the company**
---------------------


KPMG is a company for people who want to make a difference. We are one of the world’s leading professional services companies and a partner our clients depend on in the fast-paced world they are a part of. We provide insight and guidance on their journeys. This may mean organizational change for their company as a whole, or just parts of it. It may relate to their working methods, how to deal with potential risks, cyber threats or how to maximize user experience in a digitized world. We are also experts in analysis, M&A, auditing and tax to name just a few of our professional skills.



At KPMG, we work actively to maintain diversity and gender equality throughout the organization. Diversity brings perspectives that enrich our culture and add value for our clients and society alike. We believe in an inclusive culture that respects people for who they are and allows them to be themselves. Because this is at the heart of what we believe, we welcome applicants with different backgrounds and experiences.



In Sweden you will have 1,650 colleagues and 350 more in Lithuania and Latvia, which means there are 2,000 of us in the company. You will be part of KPMG’s worldwide network of more than 200,000 people.
company_description: At KPMG, you'll be able to tap into your skills, expertise and passion to help organizations find sustainable solutions to the world's most pressing issues.

title: Customer Engineer, Applied AI (English, Swedish)
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
* 10 years of experience building integrations using one of more of the following languages: Python, Node.js, Go, or Java.
* 10 years of experience building conversational applications and contact center applications.
* Ability to travel up to 50% of the time, as required.
* Ability to communicate in English and Swedish for this client-facing role.


**Preferred qualifications:**  

* Experience with modern cloud architectures and technologies.
* Experience in building reusable assets like demos and high level architecture as part of training and enablement programs.
* Experience in responding to RFI/RFP.
* Experience with contact center technologies and platforms (e.g., Avaya, Genesys, Cisco, Mitel, Twilio, Liveperson, etc.) or Cloud Contact Center solutions.


About the job
  
  

The Customer Engagement Suite with Google Applied AI delights customers with an end-to-end application that combines our most advanced conversational AI, with multi-modal and omnichannel functionality to deliver exceptional customer experiences at every touch-point.
  
As an EMEA Applied AI Customer Engineer, you will be responsible for growing the adoption of Customer Engagement in EMEA by virtue of your experience in building conversational applications. You will form part of a central and highly specialized technical team that engages directly with customers and partners with the focus to accelerate the usage of Conversational AI solutions on Google Cloud Platform. You will work with cross-functional peers to support selected enterprise customers in their adoption journey. You will grow the ecosystem of partners by running technical workshops and training. You will run demonstrations and small proofs of concept with customers and provide feedback to Global Product Leads and Product Management.Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Conduct technical pre-business activity in establishing technical viability and fit for the customers with the Applied AI suite (e.g., Including Conversational Agents, Agent Assist, Conversational Insights and Google Contact Center AI Platform (CCaaS), etc.).
* Build and nurture a community of AI partners and practitioners for Applied AI across EMEA.
* Reflect the feedback of EMEA customers, partners, and the field to influence product direction.
* Partner closely with Customer Engineering leaders, Product leaders, business strategy, Developer Advocates and executive leadership to execute the Applied strategy.


Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See alsoGoogle's EEO Policy andEEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing ourAccommodations for Applicants form.

title: QA Engineer - Markets
description:
**ABOUT THE ROLE**


Are you an experienced software engineer looking for a meaningful role in a dynamic environment? Join our Markets Platform Team at LeoVegas Group, where you will play a crucial role in enhancing our global customer onboarding process and developing responsible gaming features. Your work will ensure a seamless, secure, and enjoyable experience for our customers across all our brands.

  

In this position, you will focus on refining the onboarding journey and promoting responsible gaming. Our mission is to create a safe gaming environment where players can set healthy limits on their gambling habits. We leverage data-driven insights and a robust CI/CD process, following the Kanban methodology to deliver high-quality solutions. You will work alongside expert back-end developers specialising in Java and Kotlin, as well as dedicated Quality Assurance Engineers.

  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**

* Developing a multi-brand gaming platform called Rhino, built on 230+ microservices.
* Driving continuous improvement in the player onboarding process and responsible gaming solutions through innovative solutions.
* Testing (unit, regression, smoke) and updating documentation.
* Participating in architectural discussions and suggesting ideas for technical improvements.
* Collaborate with Product Managers and other stakeholders to deliver innovative solutions that enhance customer onboarding and promote responsible gaming.
* Working closely with Backend Engineers, QA Engineers and TA Engineers.

 **OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE THE FOLLOWING:**


ESSENTIAL SKILLS

* Min. 4 years of experience in using Java + Spring Boot framework
* You have experience with MySQL
* You are familiar with microservice architectures
* You are ISTQB certified


NICE TO HAVES

* Experience with Kotlin, Git, Kafka, Jenkins, Akka, Hazelcast, Elasticsearch, RabbitMQ, with Consul.
* Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform and BigQuery.
* Strong understanding of API testing methodologies and hands-on experience with tools like Postman.
* Knowledge of Automated Testing.

 **WHO WE ARE**


At the core of LeoVegas Group is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1400 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 11 offices worldwide.  



**BENEFITS**

* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation day
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enroll in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights.

 **JOIN US!**


In our pride, we empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait for things to happen; we pounce and make it happen!

  

Would you be a good fit for the Leo Pride - give us a roar!

  

\*\*As our company working language is English, we’d like to see your CV in English, please\*\*
