title: Enterprise Product Evangelist
job_function: General Business, Management, and Business Development
description:
**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**
 As an Enterprise Product Evangelist, you will play a crucial role in our product team, serving as the key liaison between our Enterprise clients, Enterprise sales team, and the broader product organization. Your role will be to champion the needs of Enterprise clients within Product, ensuring our product improvements align with business goals and drive customer success.
   

  

 You will advocate for customer challenges, prioritize enterprise requirements, and contribute to our strategic roadmap, ensuring our enterprise product offerings exceed our customer expectations.
   

  

**Your key responsibilities include:**
* Enterprise Advocacy: Act as the voice of Enterprise clients within the product team, ensuring their needs and challenges are well-represented.
* Business Case Development: Translate Enterprise customer pain points into clear, compelling business cases that drive impactful product enhancements.
* Prioritization & Communication: Collaborate with internal teams to prioritize Enterprise issues, effectively communicating impact and urgency.
* Roadmap Oversight: Maintain a comprehensive view of the Enterprise product roadmap, identifying and addressing blockers to ensure smooth execution.
* Strategic Bridge: Act as the key bridge between product and its growing portfolio of Enterprise clients, fostering strong collaboration and long-term success.
* Product Strategy: Provide an Enterprise perspective to inform and shape product strategy, ensuring alignment with business and customer needs.


**Requirements**
* Proven experience in a customer advocacy, product management, or business strategy role within a SaaS or technology-driven environment.
* Strong ability to translate customer pain points into actionable business insights.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
* Ability to work cross-functionally with product, engineering, and business teams.
* Experience partnering with Enterprise-level clients and understanding their complex needs.
* Passion for driving customer success and influencing product innovation.


**Soft Requirements**
* Strong problem-solving skills and analytical thinking.
* Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, evolving environment.
* Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills.
* Proactive mindset with a strong sense of ownership and accountability.


**Nice to have:**
* Experience with enterprise SaaS products and sales processes.
* Familiarity with customer journey mapping and business case development.
* Background in music, media, or streaming industries.


**Equal Opportunity Employer** 
 We believe that bringing people together from different backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives makes for a healthy workplace, a more successful business, and a better world. We value diversity and encourage everyone to come and soundtrack the world with us.
   

  

**Application** 
 Ready to make the world feel your work? Please apply, in English, by clicking the link “Interested” below.
   

  

**Join our global force of 500+ innovators, blending the latest in tech with the greatest in soundtracking, from our Stockholm HQ to offices in London, New York, Los Angeles, Berlin, Oslo, and Seoul. We’re an industry leader with a startup mentality. We take what we do seriously, but we don’t take ourselves too seriously. Creating and collaborating to transform the sound of streaming, content, and culture. Come join us—and let the world feel your work.**

title: Professional Services Consultant - Nordics
description:
**Connect with Quadient**
 At Quadient, we support businesses of all sizes in their digital transformation and growth journey, unlocking operational efficiency with reliable, secure, and sustainable automation processes. Our success in delivering innovation and business growth is inspired by the connections our diverse teams create every day, with our clients and each other. It’s these connections that make Quadient such an exceptional place to grow your career, develop your skills and make a real impact – help our future-focused business lead the way in powering secure and sustainable business connections through digital and physical channels.
   

  

 Are you someone who likes to use your creativity and problem-solving skills to overcome technical challenges and provide best in class solutions to clients needs?
   

  

 Do you enjoy communicating and collaborating with both internal and external teams of technical and non-technical people, designing, presenting and demonstrating the value-add your solutions can bring?
   

  

 We’re looking for a Professional Services Consultant to join our team in Sweden. Read on for more information…
   

  

**Your role in our future**
 You will be an important member of our Professional Services team, dedicated to the success of customers’ virtualization strategies and their implementations. With your colleagues you will ensure that customers successfully implement Quadient’s solutions, and as a Professional Services Consultant, you will influence the success of each implementation, forming a vital link between the customer and Quadient.
   

  

 We’ve learned that if we put our thinking and efforts together, we’ll achieve better results for decisions big and small. You’ll have the opportunity to contribute at a high level because the way we see it, your input broadens our perspective as well as yours.
   

  

 You’ll engage with sales, pre-sales and project management, defining the services portion of our solution proposal, and you’ll meet with customers to clarify system specifications, gaining an understanding of their work practices and the nature of their business, in order to develop a solution to meet their needs.
   

  

 You will develop and implement agreed custom solutions, testing and installing custom software solutions, and you’ll present solutions in written or oral form, preparing documentation and presenting progress reports to customers while also working on, and organizing the delivery of projects.
   

  

 You’ll maintain integrity and professionalism when working with sensitive customer data and information, and you will also conduct training for users and other consultants, occasionally travelling to client sites.
   

  

**Your profile**
* You have proven experience in the development of custom solutions, you’ve potentially worked in a software development environment and you’re looking for a role that puts you in front of the customer.
* You’re able to demonstrate working knowledge or recent experience with scripting languages (Java), application development, databases and analytical tools and design functional specifications.
* You can quickly explore, examine and understand complex problems and how it relates to the customer’s business, and you can collaborate and listen with technical and non-technical consumers from IT administrators to executive level stakeholders.
* You’re well organized with a healthy sense of urgency, you’re able to set; communicate; and meet challenging deadlines with competing priorities.
* You can demonstrate your understanding of common enterprise applications and experience with both Windows and Unix operating systems; you’re comfortable on the command line interface.
* You enjoy the opportunity to travel, and you’re excited at the prospect of travelling mainly within the Sweden/Nordics region.
* You are a great communicator, you can deliver impact through adapting your style to your audience.


 Knowledge gaps can be filled. Even if you don’t satisfy every single requirement or meet every qualification listed, we still want to hear from you.
   

  

 Help shape the future of customer communications.
 **Apply now.**
**Rewards & Benefits**
**Flexible Work** 
 : Embrace a hybrid work model blending office and remote setup for a balanced lifestyle.
   

  

**Endless Learning:** 
 Access global opportunities for growth through our 24/7 online learning platform.
   

  

**Inclusive Community:** 
 Join diverse communities and engage in our Philanthropy program.
   

  

**Comprehensive Rewards:** 
 Enjoy competitive Total Rewards covering wellness, work/life balance, and more, including a generous referral scheme.
   

  

**Caring for Wellbeing** 
 : Access our complimentary employee assistance program for mental health support.
   

  

**Be yourself at Quadient**
 Our values define how we work as a team: Empowerment, Passion, Inspiration and Community. They inspire us to be EPIC. Together. What makes Quadient different is how different we are. We’re a team of individuals with one goal but many perspectives. When you connect with Quadient, you become part of a community that cares - in a culture that embraces differences and values every voice.
   

  

 We will consider any reasonable modifications to the interview process. If you require any assistance with the application process, please email us at careers@quadient.com
   

  

 Quadient is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer\*: We believe that diversity brings benefits to our customers, our business, and our people so we are committed to being an inclusive employer. We encourage applications from all suitable applicants, regardless of background. We firmly believe in zero discrimination in employment on any basis, including gender, race, ethnicity, religion or belief, national origin, age, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other protected characteristics.
   

  

**People. Connected.**
**#REMOTE**

title: Field Solutions Architect, Generative AI, Google Cloud
company_industry: Information Services and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Minimum qualifications:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, or equivalent practical experience.
* 6 years of experience working in AI/ML as a technical sales engineer or in software engineering.
* Experience in Python and Machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
* Experience in Generative AI as a user or a developer.


**Preferred qualifications:**
* Experience in systems design, with the ability to architect and explain data pipelines, Machine Learning (ML) pipelines, and ML training and serving approaches.
* Experience with full-stack ML engineering to seamlessly combine retrieval-based knowledge and generative text generation to implement and optimize RAG models using first-party and OSS models.
* Experience with implementing search concepts, such as indexing, scoring, relevancy, faceting, and query rewriting and expansion.
* Experience with semantic search frameworks and tools/databases such as LangChain, Faiss, and Pinecone.
* Understanding of nearest neighbor search concepts.


**About The Job**
 In this role, you will support Google Cloud Sales and Engineering teams to incubate, pilot, and deploy Google Cloud’s AI/ML and Generative AI (GenAI) technology with AI native customers, large enterprises, and early-stage AI startups. You will help customers innovate faster with solutions using Google Cloud’s flexible and open infrastructure including AI Accelerators (TPU/GPU).
   

  

 You will identify, assess, and develop GenAI and AI/ML applications by applying key industry tools, techniques, and methodologies to solve issues. You will help customers leverage accelerators within the overall cloud strategy by helping run benchmarks for existing models, finding opportunities to use accelerators for new models, developing migration paths, and helping to analyze cost to performance. You will work with internal Cloud AI teams to remove roadblocks and shape the future of our offerings.
   

  

 Google Cloud accelerates every organization’s ability to digitally transform its business and industry. We deliver enterprise-grade solutions that leverage Google’s cutting-edge technology, and tools that help developers build more sustainably. Customers in more than 200 countries and territories turn to Google Cloud as their trusted partner to enable growth and solve their most critical business problems.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Advise our customers by understanding the customer’s business process and objectives. Architect AI-drive, spanning Data, AI, and Infrastructure, and work with peers to include the full cloud stack into overall architecture.
* Work with customers, demonstrate features, tune models, optimize model performance, profiling, and bench marking. Troubleshoot and find solutions to issues training/serving models in a large-scale environment.
* Build repeatable technical assets such as scripts, templates, reference architectures to enable other customers and internal teams. Work cross-functionally to influence Google Cloud strategy and product direction at the intersection of infrastructure and AI/ML by advocating for enterprise customer requirements.
* Coordinate regional field enablement with leadership and work with product and partner organizations on external enablement activities.
* Travel as needed.


 Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

title: Data Scientist
company_industry: Advertising Services, Marketing Services, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
At Choreograph, part of GroupM, we’re leading the way in data-driven marketing solutions. We collaborate with the world’s most ambitious brands to solve complex challenges in media and marketing through data and technology. From econometrics and media buying algorithms to dashboards and strategic consulting, our work has an impact.
   

  

 At Choreograph, data science plays a key role in how we support some of the world’s largest brands in making informed decisions. By leveraging advanced analytics and innovative methodologies, we empower businesses to optimize their marketing strategies and uncover insights that drive real results.
   

  

 If you’re passionate about using data to solve challenging problems and want to work with brands such as Samsung, Tele2, Coca-Cola, TUI and L’oreal in a collaborative environment, this could be the perfect role for you!
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
 We’re looking for a Data Scientist to join our growing team in Stockholm. In this role, you will:
   

  

* Take the lead in helping our clients understand and measure the true impact of their marketing investment using measurement methods such as Marketing mix modelling.
* You will collaborate closely with colleagues to transform technical output such as outputs from a model built using Python into clear, actionable insights. Your work will involve packaging and presenting these findings in an engaging and accessible way to inform and inspire C-level stakeholders at some of the largest companies in the Nordics.
* You will contribute to exciting and impactful projects, and be able to work on projects involving attribution modeling, experiments, and algorithm development, while also contributing to the development of automated reporting tools and other innovative data science initiatives.


**Qualifications**
 Requirements-Please note that this is an entry-level position (0–2 years of experience), so the competence level of below requirements should align with skills gained through education or limited work experience.
   

  

* Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Engineering, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Business administration or similar.
* A curious and business-oriented mindset, with a willingness to learn about (or prior knowledge of) the marketing industry.
* Strong storytelling and communication skills, with the ability to explain technical issues and solutions to non-technical audiences.
* Experience from programming (we use Python as our main coding language)
* Experience applying analytical methods such as time series analysis, statistics, media mix modeling, or econometrics.
* You are fluent in both English and Swedish.
* You have a valid permit in Sweden.
* You have excellent skills in Excel and Powerpoint.


**Nice to have**
* Practical experience in a data science, analytics consultant, or similar role.
* Hands-on experience with Marketing Mix Modelling.
* Previous experience of Bayesian statistics.
* Experience with Cloud platforms, SQL, GIT, Power BI, or other relevant technologies.


**Additional Benefits At Choreograph**
* The opportunity to work with leading global and local brands in a dynamic, innovative industry.
* A collaborative, inclusive, and supportive team culture.
* Access to personal and professional development opportunities within GroupM and WPP, with clear pathways for growth.
* A centrally located office in Stockholm, with flexible hybrid work options to support work-life balance.
* Benefits, including wellness allowances, pension plans, and occupational healthcare, to support your well-being.


**Application**
 The position is a full-time permanent position with entry as soon as possible. We apply a six-month probationary period.
   

  

 In addition to reviewing your resume and conducting interviews, we incorporate a testing phase in our hiring process. Selection and interviews take place continuously, so submit your application with CV and personal letter as soon as possible.
   

  

**Contact**
 If you have questions about the position, you are welcome to contact Lisa Gröning (lisa.groning@choreograph.com) or Viktor Åhlén (viktor.ahlen@choreograph.com). We do not accept applications via e-mail.
   

  

**About GroupM**
  

  

 GroupM is one of Sweden's largest media agency groups and consists of Wavemaker, EssenceMediacom, Mindshare, Nexus and Choreograph. GroupM's primary goal is to create benefits for our clients through collaborations with the group's agencies. We do this, among other things, through economies of scale in trading, technology and data. We are part of WPP, which is one of the world's largest groups in marketing communications with over 190,000 employees on a global basis. GroupM Sweden has around 375 employees in Stockholm, Gothenburg, and Malmö.

title: Modern Workplace Engineering Architect | M365
description:
Unlock the potential of Modern Workplace Engineering Architecture as a visionary architect, transforming challenges into cutting-edge solutions and leading the transformation and the empowerment of business to thrive in the digital era with Microsoft technologies.
   

  

**Come join us**
 Are you a visionary Microsoft 365 Architect? Join our Modern Workplace Practice and unleash your expertise in crafting innovative solutions that harness the full potential of Microsoft 365 suite. You will have a pivotal role in our team as Solution Architect where you will need to understand the business needs and requirements and turn it into innovative solutions based on Microsoft technologies. You will become the front figure in projects and mentor to your peers to drive transformative success with your unparalleled skillset.
 **Together we do what matters.**
**Skills And Experiences**
 You have previous and solid experience with:
   

  

* Demonstrating confidence in designing end-to-end solutions across Microsoft 365 suite.
* Showing good control and eager leadership in managing clients' conversations.
* Understanding business advantages in Microsoft security tools (i.e. Defender and Purview).
* Implementing Microsoft Identity and Endpoint Management techniques and best practices.
* Using with natural proficiency PowerShell.
* Applying strong business acumen in migrations tools (i.e. Quest), Code controls (i.e. Git repositories), ITSM tools, Azure and automation.
* Showing a critical thinking, problem-solving and troubleshooting approach.


**About You**
 You’re a natural leader who fosters collaboration and manages dynamic teams to drive project success. You will proactively identify business opportunities to enhance and expand the range of Microsoft 365 suite business solutions provided to clients. Your interpersonal and communication skills help technical and non-technical clients engage with often complex information.
   

  

**Characteristics That Can Spell Success For This Role Are**
* Stay ahead of the curve and explore groundbreaking solutions with a genuine thirst for success.
* Be an adviser to emerging technologists on career growth opportunities.
* Act as a trusted mentor, providing performance reviews and feedback when necessary.
* Be a relationship builder, engaging with clients to ensure their satisfaction.


**What You'll Do**
 As a Modern Workplace Engineering Architect, your focus is on Microsoft 365 suite solutions within the Workplace services field. You will apply your expertise in M365 solutioning by translating business requirements into innovative technical solutions. Acting as a front figure in projects, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams under challenging circumstances to deliver high-quality solutions, ensuring customer satisfaction and fostering client relationships. You will stay updated with the latest technological trends in the Modern Workplace domain and attend partner events, sharing best practices and mentoring professional coworkers in the Modern Workplace domain to deliver cutting-edge solutions.
   

  

**Learn more**
 To learn more about the types of projects our Modern Workplace team works on check out these case studies:
   

  

* Why now is the time to modernize your communications capabilities

**Enjoy your career**
 Some of the best things about working at Avanade
   

  

* Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year, with exceptional development and training (minimum 80 hours per year for training and paid certifications)
* Real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally
* Dedicated career advisor to encourage your growth
* Engaged and helpful coworkers genuinely interested in you


  

  

 Find out more about some of our benefits Employee Benefits at Avanade | Avanade
   

  

**A great place to work**
 As you bring your skills and abilities to Avanade, you’ll get distinctive experiences, limitless learning, and ambitious growth in return. As we continue to build our diverse and inclusive culture, we become even more innovative and creative, helping us better serve our clients and communities. You’ll join a community of smart, supportive collaborators to lift, mentor, and guide you, and to lean on your expertise. You get a company purpose-built for business-critical, leading-edge technology solutions, committed to improving the way humans work, interact, and live. It’s all here, so take a closer look!
   

  

 We work hard to provide an inclusive, diverse culture with a deep sense of belonging for all our employees. Visit our Inclusion & Diversity page.
   

  

  

  

 Create a future for our people that focuses on
   

  

* Expanding your thinking
* Experimenting courageously
* Learning and pivoting


  

  

 Inspire greatness in our people by
   

  

* Empowering every voice
* Encouraging boldness
* Celebrating progress


  

  

 Accelerate the impact of our people by
   

  

* Amazing the client
* Prioritizing what matters
* Acting as one

title: Virtual Account Executive-Sweden
description:
**Extreme Networks Named to Computerworld’s 2023 List of Best Places to Work in IT!**
 Over 50,000 customers globally trust our end-to-end, cloud-driven networking solutions and rely on our top-rated services and support to accelerate their digital transformation efforts and deliver progress like never before and with double digit growth year over year, no provider is better positioned to deliver better outcomes on scale, than Extreme.
   

  

 We believe in “walking the walk” of our strong core values which enable us to successfully advance together. Diversity and Inclusion is a vital part of our values and beliefs, and we’re proud to foster an environment where every Extreme employee can thrive.
   

  

 Come become part of something big with us! We are a global leader, with hubs in Europe, North America, South America, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East.
   

  

 Virtual Account Executive is sales professional focused on acquiring and developing business within assigned territories and verticals, while looking for new logo prospects and developing existing accounts. Candidates will effectively be spending 70% of the time on active selling and 30% on supporting tasks such as network quotes, agreeing conditions with partners and other tasks related to sales.
   

  

**Virtual Sales Tasks**
* Acquire new logo business, build strong pipeline.
* Actively seeks out and develops new customers, new opportunities.
* Proactively contacting the existing clients to maximize business potential – active upsell/cross sell .
* Engaging with new leads provided by Operations Team, maximize MQL conversion into real opportunity
* Generate new sales leads and opportunities
* Acquisition and developing own customer portfolio – direct touch with end users is requirement
* Provide consistent interaction with existing customers – upsell/cross sell initiatives
* Ensures that information about new products, services, and operational changes are communicated to customers on a timely basis
* Maintain and builds account relationships.
* Represents the Company at industry trade shows and conferences – travel requirements is a must


**Other Tasks**
* Manage the day to day client meetings.
* Maintains all information about customers, including all contact information and call reports, accurately and timely in CRM (Salesforce).
* Managing the jobs from quotation stage to booking in line with the client expectations and communicating effectively any service issues.
* Manage and follow-up on quotes.
* Internal liaison with the operations team assisting with quotations and service information.
* Reporting activities to the country manager
* Strong Swedish language skills

title: Domänarkitekt - plattform
description:
Har du erfarenhet av att designa och vidareutveckla säkra och stabila plattformslösningar? Är du den nyfikna personen som gillar utmaningar? Har du viljan och förmågan att ständigt lära nytt och vara med att utveckla oss och dig själv? Vill du arbeta med en avancerad plattformsinfrastruktur i en organisation som är i stor tillväxt och med syfte att bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare? Då kan du vara den vi söker.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 Som domänarkitekt plattform hos oss får du en central roll i att säkerställa att våra system och plattformar är säkra, robusta och ändamålsenliga. Du kommer att arbeta i en miljö där höga krav på tillgänglighet, säkerhet och regelefterlevnad är en självklarhet. Din roll innebär domänarkitekt inom plattform, där du analyserar verksamhetens behov och tar fram målarkitekturer och färdplaner för plattformsområdet.
   

  

 I denna roll arbetar du nära tjänsteområdet plattform, IT-specialister och andra IT-arkitekter för att utveckla en modern och framtidssäkrad IT-infrastruktur. Vid behov stödjer du även andra projekt inom Infrastrukturstaben och verksamheten.
   

  

**Vi söker dig som**
 Du är högskoleingenjör inom relevant område eller har förvärvat motsvarande kompetens som FMV bedömer värdefull för tjänsten på annat sätt. Vi ser att du har minst 5 års erfarenhet av IT-arkitektur inom plattformsområdet. Du har även god förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på både svenska och engelska samt innehar körkort B.
   

  

 Vi ser att du har kunskap om på marknaden vanligt förekommande server och virtualiseringsmiljöer, både on-premise samt molnlösningar. Det är en fördel om du har erfarenhet av totalförsvarsgemensamma säkerhetslösningar och signalskyddssystem med tillhörande signalskyddsutbildning, samt kunskap inom Försvarsmaktens och/eller FMV:s regelverk kring kravställning av säkerhetsfunktioner.
   

  

 För att trivas och lyckas i rollen som domänarkitekt plattform hos oss ser vi att du har en vilja och förmåga att lära och utvecklas. Det innebär att du i grunden är stabil, strukturerad och kvalitetsmedveten samtidigt som du är flexibel och kreativ när du ställs inför ändrade omständigheter. Du ser möjligheter i förändringar och är orädd att presentera nya mera effektiva lösningar och arbetssätt. Du är en utpräglad lagspelare och relaterar till andra på ett lyhört och smidigt sätt.
   

  

 Hos oss har du möjlighet att nyttja din kunskap och kompetens. Vill du dessutom förkovra dig så finns det bra möjligheter till kompetensutveckling. Vi som arbetar här idag tycker om att bidra till att göra skillnad. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Välkommen till Försvarets materielverk! Vi befinner oss just nu i en spännande tid med en stor tillväxt. Som myndighet inom försvarssektorn är vårt uppdrag att leverera det som vårt svenska försvar behöver, viktigare än någonsin. Vi söker därför efter dig, som tillsammans med avdelningens medarbetare och våra samarbetspartners, vill bidra till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare.
   

  

 Infrastrukturstaben ansvarar för myndighetens IT-verksamhet, informationsförvaltning och fastighetsförvaltning.
   

  

 Avdelning för IT Drift och Infrastruktur söker nu en domänarkitekt plattform.
   

  

**FMV – Försvarets materielverk**
 På FMV är du med och bidrar till att göra Sverige och världen säkrare. Vi upphandlar, utvecklar och levererar materiel och tjänster till det svenska försvaret. I vår vision ”Rätt materiel för ett starkare försvar” ryms vårt arbete och våra leveranser till Försvarsmakten av allt från helikoptrar, ubåtar, stridsflygplan och snörade kängor till kompasser, radarstationer, pansarterrängbilar och kuddar. Bredden i vårt uppdrag ger dig möjligheten att jobba med spännande innehåll, människor och projekt. Vi sätter värde på ömsesidigt förtroende och på ett hållbart arbetsliv. Därför erbjuder vi alla våra anställda ett brett utbud av utbildningar, kompetensutveckling och träning.
   

  

**Vill du vara med och utveckla framtidens försvar?**
 Sök tjänsten via FMV:s webbplats. Vi vill ha dina ansökningshandlingar på svenska. Våra fackliga företrädare är Stefan Hållander (SACO-S), Peter Andersson (SEKO), Lars Mörrby (OFR/O) och Lena Sköld Gunnarsson (OFR/S). Alla nås på telefon 08-782 40 00 (FMV Växel). Vid frågor om tjänsten ber vi dig kontakta rekryterande chef Niclas Holmkvist via niclas.holmkvist@fmv.se.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-02-28.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan.**
 FMV finns för landet, i många delar av landet. Som medarbetare hos oss får du både en trygg och utmanande anställning och ett stort eget ansvar. För att jobba hos oss behöver du vara svensk medborgare och genomgå en säkerhetsprövning, i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Vi tillämpar provanställning och som anställd kommer du att krigsplaceras utifrån totalförsvarets behov. Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via FMV:s webbplats eller via vår registratur. Vi har redan gjort vårt medieval, därför undanber vi oss samtal från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Visual Project Specialist
description:
Would you like to work in an organization where the work you do is meaningful and will have a direct impact on the lives of millions of people and businesses? Our core business is data and how it can be utilized, to help our customers make intelligent decisions. We are together building a culture where we are described by co-workers as friendly, professional and caring and where you are encouraged to challenge yourself.
 



  





 We are searching for a Stockholm or Helsinki-based, temporary
 **Visual Project Specialist** 
 until the end of November 2025.
 



  





 Are you a visually skilled project specialist? Do you enjoy managing projects and ensuring they move forward smoothly? Do you get excited about creating B2B advertisements or renewing PowerPoint presentations? If so, we want to hear from you!
 



  





**What will you do?** 




 You will be part of our Nordic content production team, which includes colleagues in Finland, Sweden and Norway. Our skilled team produces newsletters, articles, customer stories, and brochures, as well as texts for marketing automation, advertising, and websites. In addition to a fantastic team, you will be supported by great partners. A significant part of your daily work will involve collaborating with sales, product owners, and our external partners.
 



  





 Your key responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:
 


* Leading our sales materials renewal project in Sweden and Finland. This means identifying the materials to be updated, scheduling meetings with our partners and stakeholders, and providing your expertise on the finalized materials.
* Updating PowerPoint presentations, including product materials, meeting materials, etc.
* Creating a library for all materials to ensure they are easy to find.



  





**Who are you?** 




 We're looking for a Finnish and Swedish-speaking individual with at least a 3 years of experience in content production, particularly with PowerPoints, print/digital ads and sales materials. You should have a strong visual eye and be proficient in using either Canva or Adobe Creative Cloud tools, as well as PowerPoint. It's also important that you love project management and have a strong capability to drive your own work and projects. In addition to Finnish and Swedish skills, it is an asset that you also know English, since it is our corporate language.
 



  





 We place great emphasis in personal characteristics and attitudes in our recruitments and are looking for a colleague with excellent collaboration skills and a positive, proactive and enthusiastic attitude.
 



  





**Practical information** 




 Type of employment: Temporary until end of November 2025
 



 Start date: As soon as possible
 



 Office location: Stockholm or Helsinki
 



  





 The salary for the position ranges from 3 500€ to 4 500€ / month, depending on the experience of the selected person.
 



  





**And lastly,** 
**why us?** 




 We operate in a scalable and digital business with intelligence at the core. We are continuing our exciting journey to become the Nordic knowledge company that powers society with intelligence. Here you will work in an environment with a high development phase where we continuously strive to improve our ways of working and to be innovative in our service development. You would work close to people and businesses with possibilities to make an impact.
 



  





 We are also proud of the value-based company that we are building together. You would spend your days amongst engaged, caring and competent colleagues that will support and challenge you. And if you do the same, you will make a great colleague. For us, how you act and behave towards your colleagues and external stakeholders is equally important as your competence.
 



  





 If you have any questions about the position or the recruitment process, our recruiting manager Taija Koskinen will be happy to tell you more. You can reach Taija at +358 40 534 7227 on Tuesday, March 4th, from 13-16.30 EET or Friday, March 12th, from 9-12 EET.
 



  





 We process applications during the application period, so please send your application as soon as possible, but no later than Friday, March 14th, 2025.
 



  





 If you have read this far with excitement and meet the above qualifications, we would love to hear from you. Please press "apply now" and send in your application!
 



  





  





**Curious about the application process?** 




 We want to ensure that you as a candidate receive a fair assessment in a recruitment process where all candidates are assessed on equal terms, based on what is relevant to the current role. We use
 **Alva Labs** 
 assessments to help us increase our hiring success by identifying the candidates that are most likely to thrive and be successful in the role, in addition to interviews and references. For some roles we also apply background checks.
 



  





***Equal Opportunity Employer***




*Enento Group is an equal opportunity employer. We promote diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, or veteran status.*

title: Alecta söker informationssäkerhetschef
description:
**Vill du leda och utveckla Alectas informationssäkerhet? Nu söker vi en engagerad informationssäkerhetschef (CISO) som** 
**får en central roll i att säkerställa att information och IKT-tillgångar är skyddade och att vi uppfyller säkerhetskrav.**
**Bakgrund**
 Som förvaltare av tjänstepension hanterar vi stora mängder information, inklusive person- och försäkringsuppgifter samt data kopplat till kapitalförvaltning. För att säkerställa en trygg och ansvarsfull hantering krävs att informationen är säker, tillgänglig och spårbar, något som är väldigt viktigt för våra kunders trygghet. Därför är informationssäkerhet och riskhantering en central del av vår verksamhet.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som informationssäkerhetschef har du det övergripande operativa ansvaret att leda och samordna arbetet med informationssäkerhet inom Alecta, inklusive personal- och budgetansvar. En del av din roll är att se till att verksamheten får stöd att hantera informationssäkerhetsrisker samt leda och stötta medarbetare med deras frågor.
   

  

 Du är också ansvarig för förvaltning och ständig förbättring av Alectas styrdokument gällande informationssäkerhet och digital operativ motståndskraft inklusive uppföljning av dessa.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i IT-ledningsgruppen och rapportera till CIO/IT-chef. Månadsvis kommer du även att rapportera till vår vd och på årsbasis till styrelsen. Du kommer ha ett nära samarbete med övriga centrala funktioner (Risk, Compliance och Internrevision) och medverka som stöd i deras arbete med att bedöma, utvärdera och rapportera IKT-risker och informationssäkerhet.
   

  

**Utbildning och erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har stor erfarenhet inom IT- och informationssäkerhet. Du har de senaste fem åren lett personal inom detta område och du har minst tre års erfarenhet av att tidigare vara CISO/IT-säkerhetschef, eller motsvarande, inklusive personalansvar.
   

  

**Vi ser gärna att du har några av dessa kompetenser:**
* IT-utbildning från universitet/högskola eller motsvarande yrkeskunskaper.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med informationssäkerhet inom den finansiella sektorn.
* Erfarenhet av regelefterlevnad av informationssäkerhet, gärna från finansiell sektor.
* Erfarenhet av rapportering till ledningsgrupp och/eller styrelse.
* Erfarenhet av framtagande och förvaltning av styrdokument relaterade till ledningssystem för informationssäkerhet.
* Erfarenhet av kravställning och uppföljning gentemot IT-tjänsteleverantörer.
* God förmåga att kommunicera och utbilda inom informationssäkerhet.


**Vem är du?**
 För att trivas och lyckas i ditt arbete är det viktigt att du:
   

  

* Är prestigelös, flexibel och ansvarstagande.
* Gillar att få ihop detaljer till en helhet, tar initiativ och vill förstå vår verksamhet.
* Trivs med att leda och utveckla dina medarbetare samt skapa en stark teamkänsla.
* Kan lösa problem både självständigt och tillsammans med andra.


**Bli en del av ett välmående och vänligt företag**
 Vi vill att du ska må bra på jobbet och erbjuder därför goda möjligheter till balans i just ditt liv. Som anställd hos oss kommer du att få generösa friskvårdsförmåner, tillgång till träningslokaler på jobbet, extra semesterdagar, lunchsubvention och mycket mer.
   

  

 Vi sitter i stora, fina lokaler i centrala Stockholm. Det finns goda möjligheter till hybridarbete samtidigt som vi är övertygade om att fysiskt träffa sina kollegor är en del av teamets framgång och även ett sätt att värna om Alectas historia och företagskultur.
   

  

**Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!**
 Skicka in din ansökan i form av ett personligt brev och CV. Vi gör löpande urval och intervjuer, sista ansökningsdag är den 15 mars 2025.
   

  

 För mer information om tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Ulf Larsson, IT-chef, via mejl ulf.larsson@alecta.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare är Birgitta Pernkrans (Forena), telefon 08-441 60 42 och Hannes Hultcrantz, (SACO) telefon 08-441 60 15.
   

  

*Alecta är förvaltare av tjänstepension sedan 1917. Vårt uppdrag är att ge kollektivavtalade tjänstepensioner så stort värde som möjligt för både våra företags- och privatkunder. Det gör vi genom god avkastning, bra kundservice och låga kostnader. Vi förvaltar mer än 1000 miljarder kronor åt våra ägare som är 2,6 miljoner privatkunder och 35 000 företagskunder.*

title: Supporttekniker sökes till Nordlo i Stockholm
description:
Är du serviceinriktad, har ett brinnande IT-intresse och erfarenhet av IT-support? Då är detta tjänsten för dig!
   

  

**Vem söker vi?**
 Vi på Nordlo Evolve söker en ny medarbetare till vår servicedesk. Du som söker bör vara snabblärd, engagerad och ha ett brinnande intresse för IT. Du behöver kunna arbeta bra i team och ha en stark laganda men också kunna jobba självständigt. För att bidra till ett positivt klimat på arbetsplatsen passar du för denna tjänst om du har en god kommunikativ förmåga, är lösningsorienterad, ansvarsfull, positiv samt håller en hög servicenivå. Du är en person som söker utveckling och vill växa i din roll framåt. Vi har tydliga interna utvecklingsmöjligheter.
   

  

**Din roll**
 Som medarbetare i vår servicedesk är du ansiktet ut mot våra kunder. Via telefon, mejl och fjärrstyrning har du och dina kollegor ett brett ansvar där ni svarar på samtliga inkommande ärenden. Därför innebär inte rollen en klassisk Helpdesk-, 1st line-roll, utan du förväntas svara på alla typer av ärenden. Ärenden varierar i karaktär och kan ha en hög svårighetsgrad som behöver lösas. Det handlar om allt från fel kopplat till applikationer, uppdatering av program, felsökning av nätverk, till installationer, onsite uppdrag och ansvar för leveranser.
   

  

**Din profil och kvalifikationer**
 En relevant utbildning eller yrkeserfarenhet inom IT. Du har minst ett års erfarenhet av arbete i servicedesk och tidigare erfarenheter av kundkontakt eller service. Vi ser också att du kan uttrycka dig oförhindrat i svenska och engelska och har en god förmåga att kommunicera.
   

  

 Du bör även ha erfarenhet av följande:
   

  

* Microsoft 365
* Active Directory (On-prem eller Entra ID)
* Intune/Group Policies
* Windows Server Windows 10/11
* Remote Desktop/Virtual Desktop
* OS X (meriterande)


**Meriterande**
* ITIL kunskaper


**Om Nordlo**
 Nordlo är en av Nordens ledande aktörer inom moln och infrastruktur. Vi erbjuder skalbara driftlösningar, managerade tjänster och full outsourcing av IT- och digitaliseringstjänster till företag och offentliga verksamheter. Genom nära samarbete och med ansvarsfulla val av innovativ teknik hjälper vi våra kunder att stärka sin konkurrenskraft och driva digitaliseringen framåt.
   

  

 Nordlo omsätter 2,4 miljarder SEK, har ca 1000 anställda på orter över hela Sverige och stora delar av Norge.
   

  

 Vill du veta mer? På vår hemsida kan du läsa om vår verksamhet, kundcase och våra medarbetare.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Stockholm | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/18 | Publicerat: 2025-02-28 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-03-31

title: Erfaren IT-infrastrukturspecialist till globalt företag
description:
Till vår kund i centrala Stockholm söker vi en erfaren och engagerad IT-infrastrukturspecialist som vill arbeta med drift och förvaltning av en stabil och affärskritisk IT-miljö tillsammans med ett sammansvetsat infrastrukturteam. Här får du en nyckelroll där du arbetar brett med serverhantering, nätverk och säkerhet i en miljö som ständigt utvecklas.
 



  





 Tjänsten börjar som ett konsultuppdrag via Centric, och efter sex månader kommer anställningen att övergå direkt till kunden. Detta är en utmärkt möjlighet för dig som vill ta nästa steg i din karriär och bidra med din expertis i en internationell organisation med långsiktigt fokus på tillförlitlig IT-infrastruktur.
 



  





**Dina arbetsuppgifter** 



* Hantering av virtuella maskiner (implementering, förvaltning och avveckling) i VMware- och Nutanix-miljö
* Hantering av Windows servermiljön (onprem)
* Felsökning och drift av Cisco LAN och trådlösa nätverk
* Leda och delta i projekt
* Hantering av brandväggsregler och ständigt förbättra säkerheten i våra miljöer
* Självständigt och tillsammans med andra lokala och globala team vara drivande i att utveckla befintlig miljö och implementera nya system
* Incidenthantering
* Stötta verksamheten vid implementering och uppgradering av verksamhetssystem



  





**Din Profil Och KvalifikationerKrav** 



* Minst 4-6 års yrkeserfarenhet inom relevanta områden
* Relevant högskole-/universitetsutbildning och CCNA eller motsvarande kunskap
* Erfarenhet av drift och underhåll av nätverk, Windows serverar, Active Directory, GPO och VMware
* Scripting kunskaper
* Flytande i tal och skrift i både svenska och engelska



  





*Det är meriterande om du har gått kurser eller innehar certifikat från VMware, Nutanix, Microsoft, Cisco och ITIL.* 




  





**Vad vi erbjuder** 




 På Centric får du de verktyg du behöver för att nå dina mål. Vi erbjuder alla våra konsulter kvalificerade utbildningar och certifieringar inom den senaste tekniken. Vi tycker nämligen att våra medarbetare hela tiden ska fortsätta att utvecklas. Därför erbjuder vi dig möjligheten att lägga upp en individuell utbildningsplan, där vi bekostar såväl studiematerial som själva certifieringarna. Under din utveckling kommer vi matcha din kompetens mot rätt uppdrag i takt med att du avancerar. Vi genomför regelbundet spännande aktiviteter där du som konsult får möjlighet att träffa och umgås med dina kollegor under roliga och avslappnande former.
 



  





*Mer om oss* 




 Centric är ett IT-företag med 380 anställda, med kontor i Stockholm, Göteborg, Malmö och Linköping. Vi specialiserar oss på uthyrning av generalister och förmedling av specialister samt erbjuder outsourcing och systemlösningar inom retail. Vi är medlem i Almega Kompetensföretagen och följer deras tecknade kollektivavtal med Unionen.

title: Solution Architect - SAP Transportation Management
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions. Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**This Is Us**
 Scania is undergoing a big business transformation program for industrial operations and with that building the Industrial ERP backbone based on SAP S/4HANA. This will allow Scania to be more data centric, have a single source of truth and a modular IT landscape to enable speed and flexibility for existing and new business models. Having the standards and fundamentals in place, we will increase our agility and rapidly differentiate where we can have a competitive advantage.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 We are looking for SAP Transportation Management Solution Architect to join our team who have an interest to work with business change development and world-class IT deliveries. An important part of the change in the IT landscape will be deliveries based on SAP. As an SAP Solution Architect you are a member of the Scania SAP IT team at Digital Core. If you like challenges, now is the perfect time to join this exciting journey.
   

  

 You will get to be a part of an exciting environment where we are setting the future IT landscape for our procurement, production & logistics and finance processes. Our SAP deliveries are an important part of the change and we can see and hear the value in that. You get to be involved in setting up and enhancing the global template and drive activities in the ongoing and upcoming project releases for transport management. On top of that, you will lead initiatives to look into available SAP products in this area and identify potential fits for Scania
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
 In these projects, you will be in the forefront to design architecture based on process requirements and application and system landscape. You need to also guard the integrity of the solution and stick to standard. When required, analyze and define requirements for customer-specific development needs or integration requirements, support in the review process and also support in the change process.
   

  

 Our environment is open to your suggestions! Depending on your interest and skills, other tasks can be combined in your daily tasks for the best job possible!
   

  

**Who You Are**
* 5+ years’ experience in SAP transportation management area
* Knowledge and understanding of transport management processes and carrier communication is required
* Experience in each phase of the complete SAP TM project lifecycle required
* Strong stakeholder management with the different departments (business, IT, IT suppliers,…)
* Holistic thinking combined with a pragmatic approach
* Knowledge in SAP BN4L, SAP Yard Logistics and connecting areas like warehousing (SAP EWM) or operational procurement (S/4HANA) would be an advantage
* SAP BTP experience would be an advantage
* Experience from automotive industry would be an advantage
* Excellent communication skills in English, Swedish an added plus


 Beside those experiences you get to bring out your solution-oriented and creative mindset to help us deliver results.
   

  

**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and Midway hubs. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-03-16. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact Ayman Zalet: ayman.zalet@scania.com
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Interim Senior Enterprise Sales Manager EMEA - Stockholm
description:
We are looking for an Interim Senior Enterprise Sales Manager who will coach, mentor and lead Funnel Strategic Account Managers. In this role, you will be reporting to Adam Knapp (Global VP Partners & EMEA Revenue) and have the opportunity to make a significant impact on the direction and development of the Strategic Account Management team.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Train and lead a team of Strategic Account Managers in Stockholm & Hamburg, setting up the team to achieve revenue and development goals.
* Challenge and coach team members to reach their full potential.
* Drive new behavior such as outbound sales, working with the partner channel, and cross-sell opportunities.
* Participate in strategic customer meetings as appropriate, co-sell, and lead by example.
* Implement new ways of working, frameworks and processes to increase knowledge and expertise across the team and company.
* Establish and maintain a repeatable and predictable operating rhythm, including regular forecast, pipeline and key deal sessions.
* Adopt and increase the use of sales tools within the team.
* Nurture, evolve and refine the enterprise sales strategy, process and tactics.
* Evolve the already existing environment of collaboration and teamwork, and motivate the team to be goal-driven.
* Collaborate closely with other teams: RDR, Marketing, Solutions Consultants, Customer Success, Product, Partners.


**Who You Are**
 A goal-oriented and empathetic leader with a track record of hitting targets. You are tech-savvy and have an eye for scalable processes. You naturally build great relationships, focus on people development and enjoy problem-solving in collaboration with others.
   

  

 You have a growth mindset, you expect high standards of yourself and others, and operate with kindness and candor. You are prestigeless, empathetic and set clear expectations for yourself and your team. You are intrinsically motivated, able to motivate others, and your curiosity and open-minded attitude means you enjoy sparring and being constructively challenged by your colleagues.
   

  

**Skills And Experience**
* 10+ years of experience managing B2B software teams with a similar deal size ($50,000 ARR and above) and a focus on outbound sales.
* Upper midmarket and enterprise experience.
* Experience working in the MarTech space.
* Experience dealing with legal and procurement.
* Proven track record of exceeding personal sales targets.
* Demonstrated extensive formal leadership for a hyper-growth scale-up company.


**Who We Are**
 Take a look at our Funnel benefits!
   

  

 Funnel is the leading Marketing Intelligence platform that empowers marketers to automatically collect, model, visualize, and analyze data from over 500 marketing platforms—without the need for SQL or scripting.
   

  

 Now equipped with measurement, Funnel combines Marketing Mix Modelling, Multi Touch Attribution, and Incrementality Testing to triangulate the true effectiveness of marketing efforts and provide smart, data-driven suggestions.
   

  

 Trusted by more than 2,000 businesses worldwide, including globally recognized brands such as Adidas and Sony, Funnel generated over $50M in ARR in 2023 and continues to feature in the FT 1000 list of Europe’s fastest-growing companies.
   

  

 Since its founding in 2014, Funnel has grown into a global team of over 300 employees, with offices in Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, London, Hamburg, and Sydney.
   

  

 Other information
   

  

 This is a
 **temporary assignment** 
 lasting
 **6 to 12 months** 
 , with the possibility of extension.
   

  

 This role is located in our Stockholm office. We have an office-first approach and we value increased in-person collaboration and as such, we work four days from our office.
   

  

 Funnel is a SaaS product designed to help marketing teams own their performance. Founded in 2014 in Stockholm, and still founder-led, the Funnel team has grown with our customers – serving more than 2,000 companies from our Stockholm, Boston, Dublin, Hamburg and Sydney offices. We value increased in-person collaboration, and as such, we work a minimum of four days a week from our offices.
   

  

 We have always put the customer first, expressed in a no-commission sales model and a customer-centric development approach. We are proud to help companies such as Havas Media, Adidas, Sony, and Home Depot to unlock the true impact of their data.

title: M365 Automation Engineer
description:
### **Requirements**


* Microsoft 365.
* Azure Functions and logic apps.
* Power Platform.
* PowerShell or other script languages.
* Graph API och PnP (Patterns and Practices).
* Modern software development practices (Infrastructure as Code, GitOps etc).
* GitHub & GitHub Actions.
* Event-driven architecture (PubSub, Streaming etc).
* Serverless / Azure functions.
* SharePoint SPFx.

title: Release Manager, Evinova
description:
Transform billions of patients’ lives through technology, data, and cutting-edge ways of working. You’re disruptive, decisive, and transformative. Someone excited to use technology to improve patients’ health. We’re building a new Health-tech business – **Evinova**, a fully-owned subsidiary of AstraZeneca Group.


We’re not just building software—we’re transforming lives. If you’re passionate about leadership, collaboration, and driving innovation in healthcare, we’d love to have you join our team as a Release manager.


The Product Engineering organization consists of several self-organized/managed cross-functional teams with the people and skills needed to deliver our innovative digital products and solutions to patients and healthcare providers participating in clinical trials around the world. We are working with agile methodology delivering a new release of the software product with program increments every quarter.


In the Delivery Excellence division of Engineering, our primary focus is ensuring production releases are delivered on schedule while maintaining high standards of quality and efficiency.

**What You’ll Be Doing**  

We are a growing organization and as part of our transformation we need to expand our Release management team. Part of our transformation are improving our Release and development processes to accelerate our delivery to market from our Med tech SaaS organization. As a Release Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving these changes, providing leadership, and guiding the Release team toward operational excellence.


In collaboration with internal stakeholders, customers, product, design and engineering teams your responsibility is to plan and run continuous releases and deploys of product versions. The release team are responsible for overseeing the entire release process, from planning and coordination to execution and post-release support. The release manager acts as a liaison between different teams involved in the release process, ensuring that everyone is aligned and working towards the same goal.


Your day-to-day responsibilities will include:

* Ensure timely and accurate software releases, which includes careful planning and scheduling.
* Facilitate collaboration between multiple teams to ensure seamless delivery of features and solutions.
* Proactively handle and mitigate risks and issues that could hinder a release in collaboration with the release team and engineer.
* Work closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and ensure the releases aligns with the overall roadmaps, change initiatives and regulatory requirements.
* Secure quality in product readiness before releasing by ensuring that testing processes and milestones are followed.
* The release management team ensures smooth operation of software systems and oversees the entire process from start to finish.


To succeed in this role, you should have:

**Required Skills and Experience**:

* Technical or Business Degree
* Solid experience working in a global organization as well as managing and leading global, geographically dispersed teams and partners
* Experience in release management, release coordination, or a similar role
* Shown experience as an IT Project manager, with 5+ years of PM or Scrum master experience.
* Great communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams and functions.
* Driven by creating a high-performing team where knowledge sharing and create solutions through collaborations is what makes you smile at the end of the day.
* Experience from software product development processes and flows as well as working with Agile methods, particularly SAFe and Scrum.
* Experience and knowledge of quality systems and regulations
* Fluency in English is required.

**Desired Skills and Experience**:

* Experience of regulations such as GxP, SaMD validation or similar.
* Project manager certification.
* Scrum Master or Agile Coach certification.
* Experience of customer and stakeholder management and alignment
* Strong will to support a complex technical product, with a focus on continuous improvement and delivery
* Masters degree (business or technical degree)

**What Sets You Apart**
We’re looking for someone who:

* You have a passion for quality and take pride in deliver product releases to achieve great results.
* Is humble, approachable, and thrives in a collaborative environment.
* Works in a structured manner, paying attention to detail and quality.
* Is proactive, driven, and capable of working autonomously when needed.
* Actively contributes to creating a fun and engaging workplace culture.

**Why Evinova?**  

Evinova draws on AstraZeneca’s deep experience developing novel therapeutics, informed by insights from thousands of patients and clinical researchers. Together, we can accelerate the delivery of life-changing medicines, improve the design and delivery of clinical trials for better patient experiences and outcomes, and think more holistically about patient care before, during, and after treatment. We know that regulators, healthcare professionals, and care teams at clinical trial sites do not want a fragmented approach. They do not want a future where every pharmaceutical company provides its own, different digital solutions. They want solutions that work across the sector, simplify their workload, and benefit patients broadly. By bringing our solutions to the wider healthcare community, we can help build more unified approaches to how we all develop and deploy digital technologies, better serving our teams, physicians, and ultimately patients. Evinova represents a unique opportunity to deliver meaningful outcomes with digital and AI to serve the wider healthcare community and create new standards for the sector.


You’ll be part of a collaborative and diverse global team working with a modern tech stack in a regulatory environment. You’ll have great opportunities to grow whether it’s through tackling exciting challenges or learning from experienced colleagues.

**Location**  

When we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That's why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. The office is based in **Gothenburg** near GoCo Health Innovation Center in Mölndal. It´s close to public transportation and easy to access by car.

**Join Us**

title: Senior Online Engineer
description:
About the Role & Team


Disney Digital Entertainment, a division of Disney Experiences, is embarking on a mission to create the ‘digital front door’ for The Walt Disney Company—bringing all of Disney’s magic together into a new, interactive universe.


We are building a world-class engineering team to drive this transformation and are seeking a Senior Online Engineer to join our efforts. As a Senior Online Engineer, you will contribute to the development of high-performance, scalable platforms that support Disney’s interactive experiences for a global audience. If you thrive in high-volume, transactional environments and enjoy building robust APIs and infrastructure solutions, this role is for you!


This role can be based remotely in Sweden, Denmark, Finland or Norway.


What You Will Do

* Design, develop, and maintain high-volume, transactional software platform infrastructure that is robust, scalable, maintainable, and extendable.
* Develop platform software design specifications, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and scalability requirements.
* Create and optimize application programming interfaces (APIs) to meet the data needs of the organization and integrate seamlessly with partner platforms.
* Write reliable and efficient code capable of handling massive datasets and supporting millions of users worldwide.
* Solve complex technical challenges, contributing to the continuous improvement of tools, systems, and processes.
* Collaborate with internal teams, external partners, and cross-functional stakeholders to deliver seamless integrations and ensure robust platform performance.
* Mentor junior engineers, fostering a culture of learning and technical excellence within the team.
* Participate in short- and mid-term strategic planning, contributing to technical designs and supporting project objectives.


Required Qualifications & Skills


* Proven expertise in developing scalable, high-performance platform infrastructure for large-scale applications.
* Strong proficiency in at least one of the following programming languages: Go, Rust, Zig, or C#, with a willingness to learn and adopt new technologies.
* Demonstrated ability to design and implement APIs with an extendable architecture, ensuring seamless integration across platforms and services.
* Experience working on high-concurrency systems optimized for low-latency performance and handling massive datasets.
* Excellent problem-solving skills, with a focus on delivering practical, reliable solutions to complex challenges.
* A collaborative mindset and the ability to mentor less experienced engineers while working effectively in a distributed team environment.
* 5-8 years of progressively complex experience in software development, with a focus on backend engineering for large-scale applications.
* A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent work experience.


Why Disney Digital Entertainment?

* Be part of an innovative mission to deliver the next generation of Disney’s digital magic to fans around the globe.
* Collaborate with premier talent to build scalable systems powering Disney’s most iconic franchises, including Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars.
* Shape the backend systems for a groundbreaking new interactive experience and impact millions of players worldwide.
* Work in a collaborative, global environment where innovation, creativity, and technical excellence thrive.


The Walt Disney Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We strive to be a diverse workforce that is representative of our audiences, and where all can thrive and belong. Disney is committed to forming a team that includes and respects a variety of voices, identities, backgrounds, experiences and perspectives.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided the necessary accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive all benefits of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Sr Core Systems Engineer
description:
About the Role & Team


Disney Digital Entertainment, a division of Disney Experiences, is redefining how audiences interact with The Walt Disney Company—creating the ‘digital front door’ that unites all of Disney’s magic into a cohesive, interactive universe.


Disney Digital Entertainment is seeking talented individuals passionate about pushing the boundaries of game engine and rendering technology. As a critical part of our team, you will leverage your expertise to build and optimize feature-rich engines, ensuring smooth and high-performance experiences for global audiences.


This role can be based remotely in Sweden, Denmark, Finland or Norway.


What You Will Do

* Game Engine Expertise: Leverage proven experience in game engine or renderer development to design and implement feature-rich engines and systems.
* C++ Mastery: Write clean, maintainable, and enhanceable C++ code to develop robust game engine modules and functionality.
* Core Systems Evolution: Adapt and evolve core systems to elevate and improve Unreal Engine (UE) and Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN) development.
* Performance Optimization: Anticipate, identify, and solve complex performance issues, including profiling and optimizing for speed and memory.
* Concurrency Knowledge: Design and implement solutions for running tasks concurrently with a focus on safety and efficiency.
* Documentation and Collaboration: Create clear documentation to support team usage and ensure effective communication across disciplines.
* Mentorship: Guide and mentor less experienced team members, fostering a collaborative and growth-oriented environment.


Required Qualifications & Skills


* Experience and Curiosity: Hands-on experience or strong interest in the UEFN toolchain and modern rendering pipelines.
* Team-Oriented Mindset: A drive to support and collaborate with the entire team, ensuring alignment across disciplines.
* Communication Mastery: Exceptional skills in stakeholder management and cross-functional collaboration, effectively sharing complex information.
* Strategic Problem-Solving: The ability to anticipate and address challenges resourcefully, implementing impactful and preventative solutions.
* Technical Insight: A deep understanding of software development principles, scalable platform design, and system architecture.
* Professional Experience: 5-8 years of progressively complex experience in software development, with expertise in game engines and systems.
* Education: A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field is preferred.


Why Disney Digital Entertainment?

* Be part of an innovative mission to deliver the next generation of Disney’s digital magic to fans around the globe.
* Collaborate with premier talent to build scalable systems powering Disney’s most iconic franchises, including Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars.
* Shape the backend systems for a groundbreaking new interactive experience and impact millions of players worldwide.
* Work in a collaborative, global environment where innovation, creativity, and technical excellence thrive.

description:

title: Verification Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

 **What you’ll do at Elekta**


Are you passionate about developing cutting-edge systems that makes a real positive impact in people’s lives? Join our team and play a key role in developing the real-time embedded software that controls multiple axes in our radiation therapy devices to safely deliver radiation to patients.


As a Verification Engineer, you will be involved in all phases of our verification process - from planning and specification to execution and reporting - ensuring that our products meet the expected standards of quality and performance. Working closely with the design teams, you will ensure that the team is developing a testable design and provide early feedback on product performance, assist in test tool development, and track requirements. Your responsibilities will include writing and executing test cases (preferably automated), performing exploratory and regression testing, and identifying defects with attention to detail. You will also be involved in defining the technical testing strategy as well as creating and reviewing verification documents, test code, and technical product documentation.

**The right stuff**


To thrive in this role, you should be comfortable collaborating across multiple teams and communicating technical details effectively. You value clear, organized workflows and enjoy tackling complex challenges with a methodical, detail-oriented approach. You are motivated by continuous improvement and take pride in delivering quality outcomes.

* A collaborative mindset, with the ability to work closely with multidisciplinary teams
* Strong attention to detail and a methodical approach to problem-solving
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to present findings clearly and concisely
* A proactive, continuous improvement attitude, eager to refine testing processes and tools
* The flexibility to adapt to evolving project needs and a willingness to learn new technologies
**What you bring**


You have a proven track record in verification, ideally gained within an engineering or technical environment. You’re passionate about quality assurance and thrive on translating requirements into effective test cases. You keep yourself current with best practices and standards, recognizing the importance of robust testing in creating reliable products.

* University degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field
* Demonstrated experience in Verification, including automated testing
* Proficiency in designing, writing, and executing test cases for complex systems
* Configuration management skills, with an understanding of requirements tracking
* Experience in managing test tools and test environments
* Experience from a regulated business environment, preferably a safety critical one
* Professional proficiency in English
 **What you’ll get**


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. In addition to this, Elekta in Sweden offers a range of benefits:

* 30 paid vacation days/year, plus 4 Elekta days off/year (in addition to public holidays)
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme
* Private Medical Insurance
* Lunch Benefit
* Contribution to wellness activities
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work on location at least 3 days/week)
 **Hiring process**


We look forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and résumé in English Please note that we do not accept applications via e-mail.

 **Your Elekta contact**


For any questions or further information about this position, please contact Global Talent Acquisition Partner responsible Gustaf Ericson at gustaf.ericson@elekta.com. **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We are an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to age, race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other protected characteristic.

 **About Elekta**


As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.


More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives, and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it’s personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combines passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. **We don’t just build technology, we build hope.**


Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with a presence in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit elekta.com or follow @Elekta on Twitter and on LinkedIn.

title: Technician
description:

==============

  

Vill du arbeta inom fordonsindustrin? Se då hit!


Vi behöver nu utöka vårt AVL team här i Södertälje med en Technician till vår grupp inom Transmission&Electrification (elektriska drivlinor). Vi ser att du har 2-4 års arbetslivserfarenhet och är i början av din karriär.
